I listened, but I will also refer to that response. Obviously the question time had been presented, also because not knowing when and especially not knowing the most important part of the question time response, therefore the news on the topic of the SEA procedure, obviously we still wanted to keep attention on the point.

class: PROTEZIONE CIVILE, VIGILI DEL FUOCO E INTERVENTI PER CALAMITÀ NATURALI, Calamità naturali
name: Renzo
chunk: Colleague Guichardaz asks for the funds approved to date for the emergency related to the flood events of June 29th. With regard to the first question, the funds already approved from the regional budget amount to a total of 21 million euros, which are the subject of the various resolutions that are attached to the bill that we approved yesterday and of which I had provided her, at least for the text, a copy, as well as the other Group Leaders. To these will be added the funds allocated with the bill of the second variation of the 2024-2026 forecast, for a total of approximately 23 million euros, which the Regional Council approved this morning, Wednesday, November 6th, which will be immediately transmitted to the presence of the Council for the start of the examination of the Commissions. I would like to remind you, for the sake of clarity and for the record, that part of the 21 million, essentially the 21 million, will be - subject to reporting by the Civil Protection system on the data provided by the Municipalities and regional structures - subject to reimbursement for 20.6 million, as decided by the National Civil Protection. The news regarding the applications submitted to obtain the redundancy fund, instead - regarding the second application - the offices of the Department of Labor and Training Policies have contacted INPS which has assured maximum attention to the applications, also reporting that many of these are incomplete and therefore it has been requested, and is necessary, to provide them with integrations.

class: PROTEZIONE CIVILE, VIGILI DEL FUOCO E INTERVENTI PER CALAMITÀ NATURALI, Calamità naturali
name: Erika
chunk: The initiative obviously comes before the variation. In some way we have already had the opportunity, in part, to see that it contains a minimal part of interventions on the flood, then we saw that there is also something completely different, so from this point of view we will discuss it while discussing the variation. The communication that we had asked for and urged in that resolution voted in July, which asked for a weekly commitment to reporting on this issue, has certainly been missing. With regard to the applications for redundancy payments, I note that many months have passed and in fact these are already activities that are in difficulty: not having answers yet with regard to this part is certainly burdensome for them, so I hope that with regard to the incomplete applications there will be an answer as soon as possible, because there is also a risk of closures, in some way, because - as I say - precisely those who in good faith perhaps have not fired, have nevertheless decided to keep staff, now also find themselves in this situation. So I believe and hope that from this point of view there is a request from the competent Assessor to ensure that this money arrives as soon as possible.

class: FORESTE E TERRITORI MONTANI, ISTRUZIONE PUBBLICA
name: Erika
chunk: English: With regard to the first question ("what are the methods and details envisaged regarding the experimental interventions that will allow elementary school students to go to the mountains next spring?"), with regard to the experimentation mentioned in the introduction, I would like to point out that the Superintendence of Studies, with a view to continuity, intends to propose, starting from the current school year, 2024-2025, a project entitled "Montagne à l'école", aimed at primary school children, which can allow them to deepen their knowledge of the area they belong to, in particular from a geographical and environmental point of view, through recreational, physical and sports activities in different seasons of the year, aimed at promoting moments of sociality with secondary school children. Specifically, the project is aimed at children in the fifth grade of primary school and, in 2025-2026, also at those in the first year of lower secondary school. I would like to remind you that introducing children to the mountains is important to promote a complete physical activity, accessible to everyone, aimed at improving psychological well-being. A correct approach to the mountains, starting from the preparations for the excursion, from the backpack to the clothing and equipment, up to learning how to behave correctly along the path, respecting the environment, flora and fauna, is essential for today's young people to better understand the world around them and to be able to enjoy it in a more conscious way, also with a view to orienting them in the future. Specifically, in collaboration with the Alpine guides, the following programs have been proposed: "The mountain around us" (focused on culture and hiking, to introduce the mountains that surround the school or the town where the children live); "The vertical mountain" (focused on climbing, to introduce sport climbing, highlighting how this can be fun and educational from a psychomotor point of view. Particular attention will be paid to making children, teachers and families understand that this activity does not present objective risks when practiced correctly); "Immersion in nature" for a lower secondary school, school year 2025-2026, focused on culture and outdoor activities over two days. I would also like to emphasize that this project has an inclusive nature as it involves all children, even those with motor disabilities, thanks to the intervention of specialized mountain guides, in addition to those already provided for in the individual programs. The first two programs include, similarly to the "Scivolare" project, a theoretical part in class of two modules, together with a practical part with field trips. The theoretical part, first module, consists of a standardized presentation, approximately 15-20 minutes, similar for all schools, with video-photographic support on the Aosta Valley mountains and the various activities that can be carried out there. Following this, a specific intervention is planned for each school with short videos and photos specifically referring to the reality surrounding the school and the Municipality involved. In this part of the intervention, in addition to the characteristics of the surrounding environment, the various activities that can be carried out in the territory itself will be briefly explained. Then there is a second module, which is the explanation of how to prepare a backpack and how to plan a simple trip to the mountains in front of the house: weather, maps, paths, pay attention to any bulletins, etc. The duration is 15-20 minutes. A game will then be proposed with the students divided into groups, the aim will be to prepare a backpack by choosing the right material for a specific excursion. Then there is a practical part which is the "Mountains around us" program. They are two trips on the territory lasting 3-4 hours each, which will consist of a winter session (January-February) of walking on an easy path/terrain possibly snow-covered, with an explanation of the characteristics of the surrounding mountains, therefore slopes, plains, sunshine, different aspects of the vegetation, therefore the adret or the envers, consideration of the glaciations that formed the valley furrow, etc. Then there is a spring session (April-May), a treasure hunt with the aim of making the kids move independently on outdoor terrain, encouraging them to work in groups. The "Vertical Mountain" program consists of two outings lasting 3-4 hours each, climbing on natural or artificial sites based on logistical convenience. The period is to be defined based on the location and availability of indoor facilities. The cost of the project per class group is 1650 euros plus VAT, if due, which includes the basic cost of the guide day for the theoretical and practical part; the cost includes the living expenses of the alpine guides, transportation, meals, etc. and the equipment necessary to carry out the program. The Administration has allocated 20,000 euros for 2025 for the experimentation of the project, involving three schools of the first cycle of education in the 2024-2025 school year. With what criteria and methods will the classes that will be part of this experimental project be identified? Since this is an experimental project, we will start with three schools identified according to the following criteria: territoriality (therefore middle and lower Valley, Aosta and neighboring municipalities, upper Valley); number of projects, under regional ownership. already started by the school institution according to a rotation principle, in order to guarantee the participation of the greatest number of students attending schools in the Aosta Valley.

class: FORESTE E TERRITORI MONTANI, ISTRUZIONE PUBBLICA
name: Dennis
chunk: I thank the Councilor for this very complete answer, which touched on several topics. Above all, for each question that was asked with the interrogation, we tried to give answers for each point in the most appropriate way. It is a topic to which, as Rassemblement Valdôtain, we have always paid a lot of attention and a lot of importance, because in any case we know that the topic of the mountain and everything that concerns it is a topic that we can try to improve and change things a little, if we start from a change starting from the young people and the kids. So it is great that we start in a better way to carry out more initiatives and increasingly in synergy with other initiatives, in an integrated way, touching on the various aspects that concern the mountain, nature, safety, the risks that can happen on that terrain every day. So it is a project that we are looking at very carefully, but at the same time we hope that, as often happens, there are projects that start at an experimental level or there are occasions where... for example here it is said that the State contributed to this project - I took the information from this article - with 67,000 euros and the Region integrated the resources to complete the project, which therefore amounted to a total amount of 115,000 euros; that they are not initiatives that, as I repeat, are very important, are carried out for a year and then maybe there is some discontinuity, but there is continuity on these issues that we consider important and strategic, especially in these periods, in which we see that in the mountains there are more and more climate changes to manage suddenly and therefore going to sensitize young people, to try to make them understand the dynamics also of how to move in the mountains, of what the mountains are like, both with regards to the sporting aspect but also linked to its morphology of the territory, is very important, especially from an educational point of view and then also of approach in the field. This is one aspect. The article talked about that up to 18 years of age in Valle d'Aosta the percentage is the highest with regards to kids who practice sports activities, but then unfortunately the people of Valle d'Aosta move away from skiing. Here it would be important to understand if the article stopped there or understand from data or statistics that you may have or that can be explored, if it concerns only skiing or a decline in other disciplines and therefore understand if it is possible to work in more sectors. Another very important aspect is that we suggest, as you rightly said, obviously starting from the end of this year and then next year we will select some schools, therefore a certain number of classes, a limited number of students to start on an experimental basis with this initiative, obviously the hope is that then over the years the resources available will be increased, the project expanded to try to allow a greater number of kids, therefore as many schools as possible, to follow this path to reach the great goals of educating all young people in the best possible way about the opportunities and risks of the mountains and therefore what, in a concrete way, the Aosta Valley is for their future. That's it. Finally, it would also be very appropriate to go and convey, in addition to all the positive aspects that you mentioned in your answer, also that concept of self-responsibility that, when we address the law for the revision of the regional legal system, we will have in an article, so also this passage, bring it into this initiative, we believe that it could be a good opportunity to go and start this path in the best possible way.

class: ENERGIA, Risparmio energetico e fonti alternative
name: Luigi Giovanni
chunk: The Councilor questions the Government for information regarding the members of the technical coordination table for the development of renewable energy communities. The technical table is composed of the following entities: Sustainable Energy Development Structure, Aosta Valley Chamber of Businesses and Professions, Consortium of Local Authorities of the Aosta Valley, Coa Energia Service of Finaosta, hereinafter Coa Energia. Each of these members identifies its own representative or delegate competent in the matter. The tasks of the table are identified in the 5 paragraphs provided for in the article and give the table a whole series of activities ranging from promotion to encourage the creation of self-consumption configurations in the regional territory, to analyze the monitoring data of widespread self-consumption configurations, where available, to proactively discuss the evolution of self-consumption configurations spread across the regional territory, to propose any improvement actions of direction for the implementation of this law, to prepare an annual report for the regional Councilor competent in energy matters for the purposes of subsequent illustration to the relevant Council Commission. English: For the first question ("whether the representatives of Celva and the Chambre in the technical table will be chosen as qualified experts"), as highlighted in the premises, the choice of the representatives in charge is left to the free choice of the subjects participating in the technical table. Leaving aside the definition "perimeter of characteristics, an official or an expert must have in order to be declared qualified expert", it is difficult, in this first phase of implementation of the legislation in the field of widespread self-consumption, to be able to identify qualified expert personnel both due to the almost complete absence of training courses in this field, and due to the short period of time that has passed since the complete definition of the regulatory framework in this matter. Therefore, as specified in the resolution establishing the table, the participating subjects identify their own representative on the issues relating to CER, which we recall are various and diversified as they imply not only energy knowledge, but also legal and social knowledge, as well as the verification of the application methods and the impact of the legislation and related implementing measures with respect to the Public Administration and businesses. It is also specified that the presence of Celva and the Chambre at the technical table is not aimed only at providing technical knowledge on the matter in question, but is above all also useful for the purposes of dialogue with the territory, as a reference stakeholder for local authorities and businesses, subjects potentially interested in the development of renewable energy communities. While waiting for the formalization of the designation of the members of the technical table, a first meeting was held last Monday 28 October; during the same it was highlighted how each subject will be able to avail themselves of specific consultancy and collaboration, which may be involved in the work of the table. In particular, as regards the Region and Coa Energia, the collaboration already in place with the GSE is highlighted, the start of contacts with RSE for the definition of a collaboration agreement, in addition to the consultancy activated with the Sani Zangrando firm for the legal-administrative aspects. It is also noted that, if the technical table highlights the need to find highly specialized professionalism on specific topics to be explored, external experts may be involved and any resulting expenses may be covered in the annual operational plans of Coa Energia. "What are the names and qualifications of the members, the Cer technical table and with what provision were they identified?": similarly to what has been done on other technical tables, the adoption of a specific provision for the identification of members is not foreseen, but obviously each entity appoints them with the provisions it deems appropriate. The names have been identified by the participating subjects and will be formally transmitted. As regards the Coa Energia of Finaosta for the meeting of the table on 28 October, a note was sent with the designation of Genny Brunet to replace Andrea Comé. The formal designation was made on 31 October in the Board of Directors. We are waiting for the appointment to be formalized and registered. As regards the Chambre, Federico Molino participated. Here too, the Chambre is preparing the act of appointment and as regards Celva it was represented by Mattia Calliano and Sara Pinet was appointed as substitute. Regarding sustainable energy development, Tamara Cappellari, Simone Gamba and Ingrid Bal took part in the table. "On what date was or will the technical table insertion meeting take place?": this first table took place on October 28th and there will soon be, once formalized by all the entities, a second meeting in the coming weeks.

class: ENERGIA, Risparmio energetico e fonti alternative
name: Chiara
chunk: When I read resolution 1166 of 23 September, I must say that I felt a certain disconcertion, Councillor, because it is a resolution that takes up, but only in part, what is provided for in that law that we discussed and voted on here in July: in fact, the resolution says nothing about the actual composition of the technical table; that is, it simply follows the part of the article that is in the law, and this is the reason why I tabled the question, because - you will certainly remember - in the drafting of law number 15 - my colleagues will also remember - particular attention had been paid to identifying the tasks and composition of that table. We had insisted that the component subjects and the characteristics of these subjects that we believed were important, should be indicated in the law. You had preferred that they be indicated only in the report, not in the articles. In that resolution, however, the need for the representatives of the Chambre and Celva to be qualified technicians is not highlighted, as had been agreed, because we had mediated to reach the approval of that law and in the resolution that we saw we expected the names, also because two months had passed. We all expected there to be some more information, because the constitution and the operation of the table is an absolutely urgent thing. Now you tell us that there was a first meeting which, if I understood correctly, is not the one that has already formalized the complete composition of the table, but is preparatory to it. You told us that Dr. Molino participated for the Chambre, Calliano for Celva, but this classification, let's say, this characteristic of experience is not there. You tell me "they must not only be technicians with knowledge in the energy field, but there must also be someone who knows the economic reality and that of the Municipalities well"; no one says no, but what had been agreed was something absolutely different. This answer does not satisfy me because the compromise that had been reached was not respected. The other issue is that we approved a law, if I remember correctly, on July 27-28; on October 28 (so three months have passed), this table still does not formally exist, because someone has appointed, someone must appoint, the formal designation of the Coa has arrived, but the others are being awaited. I believe that we need to shift into a different gear because there is an urgency that we have reported over and over again and that concerns the process that underlies the creation, constitution and diffusion of the CERs, because as far as the public CERs are concerned we are absolutely at sea and - as I have already said more than once - we are worried because the impression is that there is no concrete and effective will to operate. Not only that. The CER movement in Valle d'Aosta could be robust and should be widespread; we have seen the announcement that was issued, but it seems to us, because we also spoke with someone, that Mayors and Administrators are in difficulty and we are increasingly convinced, even compared to before, that without a regional direction the risk is that in the end something extremely minimal, limited and not very incisive will be realized. In our opinion, it is a shame, because there is a risk of not fully grasping an opportunity that is important and that in our region could have a notable development.

class: TRASPORTI E VIABILITÀ, Trasporti
name: Luigi Giovanni
chunk: Colleague Manfrin, I had a bit of a hard time organizing the answer. I say this sincerely, but in the sense that, if it is possible to have some more information, I will undertake to complete it, because from some premises it was difficult to try to organize an answer. In any case, to come to the first question ("if you are aware of what was reported"), there is more than one report here, but precise references are missing. I repeat, I will try to give you some answers, but let's consider the initiative open to subsequent information. As for the first premise (a letter was sent to the media saying that the bus takes an hour and a half), there are different travel times: there are, for example, direct buses Aosta-Ivrea, which take less than an hour. The replacement service must, by its nature, try to give an answer to all users in the area, so there are buses that stop at all the stops, there are direct buses, there are semi-direct buses, those that take people to the lower Valley, and we are increasingly using motorway routes and therefore the travel times are not an hour and a half, but can also be an hour and a half when we have to give continuity to people's journeys. "I learned from reports received - I'm going to the premises because I believe the question is articulated on the various premises - that sometimes the replacement buses planned do not actually perform the service": we are not aware of this, there is also a whole check that is done, obviously, and when this happens it is reported. The reserve is started in the case that it needs to be replaced, but a service must be done; when it is not carried out in some way it must - unless something particular has happened - be integrated with the organization that they have given us. We have extended the reserve precisely to give continuity to all seasons and to understand well what the effects of the service are. Then there is another consideration: "I learned specifically that on September 16th of the three scheduled trips departing from Ivrea, with two that had... the "semi" direct trip scheduled was cancelled..." There is a long premise, here we were unable to understand what it was about and so maybe if you have more information I will collect it again. On September 16th there was a change in timetable, so I don't know if this refers to that moment of timetable change, if there is more information, but, I repeat, with respect to this we undertake to do a further check. The episode of the transfer seems very strange to us, we have not had any news and, I repeat, there is a check both by Trenitalia and by us with an adequate service. If there is something that has escaped we will gladly look into it further. It then says "finally learned of cases of cancellation of scheduled trips that have occurred several times": the cancellation of trips certainly does not occur to this extent, it can happen; in this specific case it can happen in some situations. It happens almost more on the railway section because there are interruptions that are due to infrastructure problems and it can happen in this sense. Those are then re-protected with the motorway trips. However, I repeat, all this is the objective of further investigation and we will gladly, if there are reports, complete our analysis. To come to the second question ("if the managers of the replacement trips have informed the Department about the cancelled trips"): with respect to the information, we are the ones who intervene directly through Trenitalia, there is an operations room that works daily with respect to the organization of the services. If there are cancellations, there is a whole procedure that is activated and we verify on a sample basis - a very important sample with our services - the quality of the service provided by traveling directly with the personnel who deal with these checks on the replacement buses. As for "whether replacement trips were paid to the route managers without the service being performed", this must not happen, there is a contract that regulates the relationships. We work on a quarterly basis. All trips are subject to inspection. For each trip there is a registration of the departure and arrival points, so if this were to happen it must be included in this quarterly report, where the checks and payments are then made. So, I repeat, it is an answer, mine, perhaps not so detailed. If there is more specific information or more specific requests from you we will continue to investigate, and, I repeat, precisely because all this is regulated, the Region... the contract is managed by Trenitalia, which has entrusted this service to Busitalia through a manager. We are not the ones who manage the contract, but obviously we bear the costs, as we did for rail transport, so we are available to continue to control the services.

class: TRASPORTI E VIABILITÀ, Trasporti
name: Andrea Fabrizio
chunk: Thank you Councillor for your response, which I realise was not easy, also because, in reality, we were - I tell you frankly - a bit overwhelmed by these reports and therefore even making a selection was not easy. The problem is that - I will summarise it briefly, then at this point I will send you the precise reports - I think it is a bit difficult to reconstruct ex post what happened, but I think that the clearest and most effective part of your response is the one where you say that you are not aware of any cancellations of journeys. In reality what has been reported is that these cancellations have occurred and have been made on several occasions and trivially again on Sunday there was a real struggle to manage to get off in Turin. Four hours of travel between cancellations, missed connections with trains, drivers who announced that the train would wait because there was the famous delay, the one that was also talked about today with the Santhià link road, and then afterwards in reality no train waited and therefore there was then an extension of the times. There are some critical issues that, however, evidently, from your response it is clear that they are not communicated; at this point we will detail them with the times and schedules. I do not know if then with the detail of the times of the schedules you will be able to go to the company to ask for an account of these cancellations because, at this point, if they have not been communicated, the answer will be "we are not aware of it"; however, clearly the indications are there. Trivially, I believe that however, by reporting at least this, that is, the letter that was transmitted and published by some media outlets regarding the issue of travel times, you were able to take note - I imagine - at least of this. I imagine so. At least you were able to reconstruct this and I think it is the part you mentioned, that is, the issue of the routes that take longer or shorter. What I am pointing out to you is that perhaps there are some inconsistencies that need to be looked into, especially when it is said that there are a number of replacement buses that provide a service and then in reality they are a smaller number, so probably some further investigation in this sense will need to be done and we will provide you with all the documentation. For the moment, we thank you and we are certain that at least this report - although not so precise and exhaustive, but we were convinced that you were aware of everything - will stimulate greater attention from now on.

class: TRASPORTI E VIABILITÀ, Trasporti
name: Luigi Giovanni
chunk: The question is about the information regarding the timetable for the electrification works on the Ivrea-Aosta railway line. The question is "whether all the preparatory activities planned for the period January-May 2024 are concluded": the preparatory activities for the works in progress are concluded, some preparatory activities still need to be carried out as they are functional to the works that will be carried out later. Point two ("whether all the works whose programme envisaged the start of the works in the months of June, July, September, October 2024 have actually started"), having heard RFI, which confirms that the works in progress are aligned with the programme. "With what system and methods does the Region provide for the permanent monitoring of the construction of the works?": obviously, the monitoring takes place through the continuous discussions of the technical structures with the technical structures of RFI, through a punctual control also by the structures with respect to the progress of the design. Obviously, it is not the Region that manages the contract with the company that carries out the work and therefore the dialogue is an ongoing dialogue with RFI. At this time there are daily contacts with the other actors that must be involved in the construction site works, in particular the local authorities, because there is a schedule both with respect to the works of the electrification of the railway and with respect to what must then be budgeted in terms of road and travel and construction sites, also on the investments that are made, affecting regional roads or municipal roads. The work is a work that takes into account the many aspects and the many complexities on which we must try to work together, moving forward quickly, also given the execution times of these works which, we remember, must be completed by June 2026.

class: TRASPORTI E VIABILITÀ, Trasporti
name: Chiara
chunk: One of the answers regarding the timetable had been somewhat anticipated in that meeting on October 8th, namely that, according to the CEO, there is confirmation that the works will be completed as planned by 2026 and in reality by the first part of the year, the first six months of 2026, because then we know that the following six months will be those necessary for testing and all that is the most bureaucratic part, to get to the reopening of the line in December 2026. On that occasion, which was the one in which the protocol was also signed, some details, in the first part, had come; then, as we were saying this morning, little had been said about the issue of the memorandum of understanding and, in my opinion, there is little in what I received, because I expected different things. But, beyond this, the timetable, which I had received with access to the documents in May 2024, envisaged a whole series of works, detailed interventions, very detailed, with starting dates and that was what I wanted to have confirmations on. You told me that we are aligned with what the timetable was. I would have been happier if you had given a detail, also because for what concerns, for example, the electrical substations: for Aosta there was talk of starting work in October 2024, as well as for what concerns the interventions and the passenger buildings, in July 2024. On the Aosta issue I am not so sure that everything is like this - also because October ended a few days ago, this must also be said -, but we hope that this timetable is followed word for word as it was sent. We were also told that there could be variations, because during the work it is possible that this is the case, but at the moment you tell us that everything is confirmed, so we will check. On the issue of the methods with which the Region provides monitoring, you say "we are not the ones in charge of the works, it is RFI, so there is a dialogue, but they are the ones who must follow the works more specifically". Well, what we certainly recommend is that there be a control, as I am sure has been done and I hope will continue to be, punctual and continuous. I also say this because I know that there are difficulties with regard to the personnel who must be in charge of this, given that unfortunately there are shortages at the level of staff and it is not a fault, but it is a fact. On the issue of the timetable, you told me "we are aligned" and did not tell me about variations, so I take what was delivered in May as valid and we will see to verify these works punctually, as they were done.

class: TRASPORTI E VIABILITÀ, Impianti a fune
name: Luigi Giovanni
chunk: "Timing and costs for the construction of the new Pila-Couis cableway project". The first question asks about the status of the design of the works relating to the hypothesized Stella del Couis: the executive design of the new Pila-Couis cableway and the annexed panoramic bar-restaurant was approved by the Board of Directors of the Pila company on 10/06/2024, following the successful conclusion of the preventive verification activity provided for by Article 26 of Legislative Decree 50/2016. Consequently, during the summer of 2024, it was possible to proceed with the construction of the panoramic bar-restaurant at the same time as the construction of the second section of the cableway system. With reference to the panoramic bar-restaurant, all the reinforced concrete structures, the metal carpentry structures and a part of the civil systems have been completed at present. The completion of the roofing and the installation of the external infill windows are currently underway, while the completion of the works with the completion of the civil systems and the finishing touches is expected during the next summer. "Whether a study has been planned to identify the best management configuration of the refuge": yes, a study is planned. The company has appointed a professional expert in the field, with an economic-financial plan relating to the refreshment point, which summarises the patrimonial, financial and economic implications deriving from the implementation of the investment in the relative management. Regarding question three ("timing and costs of the entire Pila-Couis cableway operation, including snowmaking systems, adoption of water and fuel, renewable energy systems, construction of the refuge"), the work schedule foresees the completion of the works during the next summer, with the construction of the first section of the service centre system planned at the departure station and the completion of the panoramic bar-restaurant in time for the start of the 2025-2026 winter season. With regard to the ancillary works, in particular the slope adaptation works, including the creation of avalanche and fall protection systems and the programmed snowmaking system, almost all the planned works have been completed, with the exception of some interfering sections of the snowmaking system line, which will consequently be built during the next summer. The overall cost of the work, including the bar-restaurant, ancillary works, slope adaptation, snowmaking system, protection systems and everything else needed, is more than 60 million euros and is distributed through direct financing from Pila, self-financing financing and the use of financing provided for by law 8. Surely, before the start of the Christmas holidays the second section of the system will be activated, the one that connects Couis 1, so there will already be the possibility of using a part of the system starting this year. The company's goal is to speed up the final and investment operations, to be able to complete the tests even before the holidays, however, at the moment, we are not able to give a definitive and certain date for the start of the use of this second section.

class: TRASPORTI E VIABILITÀ, Impianti a fune
name: Diego
chunk: In the meantime, I thank you, Councilor, for your response. I must correct the criticism I made of you in the last Council when - I already had the opportunity to say it on the street - I gave you a seriously insufficient rating. I saw that the freight elevator was then fixed here at the station and so well done for the prompt intervention. It is also true that a bike could fit in that freight elevator and I didn't think it could fit, so I change that response from "seriously" to "just insufficient". Anyway, thank you. Instead, let's talk about Pila. The Couis Star... On February 8, I asked you these questions and you rightly, answering about the work that was in progress, the work to build the upstream section, had the opportunity to say that the work relating to the panoramic refreshment point will start during the next summer - as you have actually confirmed to me now -, carried out at the same time as the construction of the second section of the cableway system. At the same time, however, he said, "the executive project relating to the non-cableway works is being perfected, it will be submitted as soon as possible to the verification provided for in article 26, etc.", that's what he still said. And I'm stuck there; I probably missed some passages, but you remember well and I understand that you have a lot of commitments, but you had promised to provide us with a more complete detail of the study, we had asked for some planning, some graphic reporting of this work, we didn't get anything and now we find ourselves with this work already completed. The second question concerned the study carried out, whether it was possible to have a report or a mention in the Commission. He had also promised us that he would come to the Commission to report. I haven't heard anything about the Pila station, but this study on the management of the Couis 1 refuge, if there was a way to have some more information, I think it would be useful for the entire population. We learned that before the holidays, section II will probably already be in operation, so it's certainly good news that everyone is eagerly awaiting; but I continue to have many doubts about the Stella del Couis structure - and I wrote it down in the introduction - because we have Councilor Sapinet, President Testolin who continue to remind us that there is a dramatic climate change, extreme weather conditions that require a different way of managing the mountain or the territory and then we build a structure that I will be curious to see how long it will be able to resist the meteorological impact on the Platta di Grevon, an area truly battered by bad weather; but we hope for the sun, that there will always be beautiful days. I continue to have doubts, I am curious to see what will be achieved. I reiterate the fact that we have not seen a single document, a single project. We must trust his words. He had promised us a lot of information, we have not received it. We will see.

class: INDUSTRIA, LAVORO
name: Luigi Giovanni
chunk: Councilor Guichardaz questions the Government for news on the prospects for ensuring job retention at the Eltek and Itw Fusion plants in Hône. Obviously, the Government on these two plants, but as on the general situation regarding the automotive sector, has continuous contact with the activity of companies having tasks that obviously cannot be management or direct intervention, but relationships with respect to the activity and the fallout of a situation that at a European level in particular is causing major problems for the entire automotive supply chain, even in important countries such as Germany. We have all read about the negotiations that are underway with respect to some large manufacturing companies, so all of this in some way at this moment creates problems for the entire supply chain. From what we have learned, but also from what we have said to each other at this moment, it is still a moment of management of the situation. They are two slightly different situations, those of the two plants: Itw is completely tied to the automotive sector, while Eltek for part of its production is also starting to work in the biomedical sector. This is a bit of the fruit of the research activity of the past years, we hope that in this perspective a supply chain within the company production that goes in this direction can continue to grow, because this diversification of production, as always, can also be useful with respect to the general market situation. For the rest of the production, Eltek also deals with the household appliances and automotive sector, so with respect to this, at this moment, there are some attentions. What I have been able to ascertain in the relationships with the two companies is that however it is a limited period, requested in a greater way than what is the real use, in particular for now we are dealing with... The redundancy fund on Eltek concerns a complete shift of work for a department. The hope is that there will be a recovery starting from the next semester, but at this moment it does not depend directly on the company. The same goes for Itw, which above all has also tried to regulate the warehouse management activity precisely because there is a decline at the moment and the request for redundancy payments is needed to try to organize the work stoppage phase as best as possible, trying to distribute it equally among all workers, trying to be as careful as possible not to burden one department rather than another. The commitment I have at the moment is to maintain contact with these two companies and to continue investing in the research sectors trying to create conditions so that all companies in general, not just these, can continue to try to build development projects, even in different directions, and what we have made a commitment to do is to hear from each other in the first few days of December to understand if the situation will persist or if in the next semester, first semester 2025, there could be any new evaluations by the two plants. The automotive sector does not only concern these two companies. As I was saying, we are also in contact with other companies that are trying to best manage this phase, which is a phase of market slowdown and we reiterate what we say here from time to time - in particular, colleague Perron supports it very determinedly - there is a need for the European Government and the Italian Government to be very clear on the automotive development projects, on the investments to be dedicated to companies. There is a huge discussion in Italy linked to Stellantis because, as we all know, the growth projects, especially for electric cars, have not been respected. There are production contractions that need to see development programs financed at a European level, at an Italian level, so that industries can return to supporting a production cycle that gives the best possible response to workers and also to the development of our territories.

class: INDUSTRIA, LAVORO
name: Erika
chunk: Councilor, we have spoken several times about the MCV of Verrès, which is also linked to Stellantis. In recent weeks, however, the unions have placed strong attention on these two plants precisely because of the issue of redundancy payments that you were talking about and above all because from this point of view there are no signs - or at least that's what we learned by reading the press releases - of any great glimmers of hope in this direction. There is great concern, so it would certainly be important to be able to address the issue of industry in the Aosta Valley sometime, which is not just CAS, but above all in the lower Valley, it is certainly an important reality and you perhaps know it better than others, so certainly from this point of view also the fact of being extremely linked to the automotive industry and above all to Stellantis is leading these companies to be in difficulty. We will certainly focus attention on these plants again later to understand if in some way the companies have found a way to recover, well aware of what you were saying about the general crisis in the automotive industry at this time.

class: SPORT E TEMPO LIBERO, Infrastrutture ricreativo-sportive
name: Davide
chunk: The colleague brings the discussion back to the Palaindoor. As he recalls in the question, the Palaindoor is included among those works defined as being of regional interest, as this regional administration intended to contribute to the costs borne by the Municipality of Aosta for the works to bring the facility up to standard in order to obtain fire prevention certification. In particular, two different resolutions have been adopted for this purpose in the last two years. Let's retrace the path: with the first, 1438 of November 2021, the Region has provided for a total financing of 470,000 euros in favor of the Municipality of Aosta as a contribution to cover 50% of the estimated costs for the fire safety adaptation of the Palaindoor. Of these, 150,000 euros are related to the works of the first lot that were concluded at the end of 2022 and allowed, as the proponent also recalls, the reactivation, starting from February 2023, of some sports activities in the structure: tennis, athletics and sport climbing. The additional 320,000 euros allocated by the Region instead concern the works of the second lot currently being completed. With the second resolution, number 1471 of December 2022, the Region granted an update of the financing, mentioned above, to partially cover the increases in costs due to the adjustment of prices for supplies and works, for a total amount of 84,000 euros, of which 20,000 on the first lot and 64,000 on the second lot. Having made these premises, which demonstrate the concrete commitment of the Regional Administration so that the Palaindoor structure can be returned in its entirety to sports groups, associations and individual citizens as soon as possible, I move on to the two questions, answering with what was received from the Municipality of Aosta. The first question that the colleague asks us is "on what date is it planned to use all the structures that make up the sports facility"? We have received the response from the Municipality of Aosta which informs us that, barring unforeseen events, the works relating to the second lot, indicated as phase one interventions, will end in December. The administrative procedures relating to obtaining the fire prevention certificate are expected to be concluded by the end of March 2025 and subsequently the Municipality plans to deliver the building to the sports office and the concessionaire. As regards the second question, "which organization will be able to take over the complete management of the sports facility, which many Regions envy us?", in relation to this point, the Municipality of Aosta recalls that with resolution of the Municipal Council, the 148 of 5 August 2024, it was decided to start the procedure for the temporary assignment of the management of the Palaindoor starting from 1 July 2024 until 31/12/2024, proceeding with the formal request to the old manager. Furthermore, it has established that the Municipal Administration will proceed with the identification, through a possible collaboration with the Regional Committee of the Coni of the Aosta Valley, of a new manager and the verification of the seriousness of the management, as well as the exact fulfillment of the conditions for the assignment of the facility itself, in the identification of the most suitable forms of management of the facility. The Municipality of Aosta also reported that in the months of August and September it held several meetings with the regional Coni representative to define in detail what is the collaboration agreement between the two entities. To date, therefore, the procedure is in the final phase and, barring any unforeseen events, the agreement can be approved and signed between the parties by the end of October 2024. It is noted that from 19:04 President Bertin resumes the presidency.

class: SPORT E TEMPO LIBERO, Infrastrutture ricreativo-sportive
name: Mauro
chunk: Thank you Councilor, I know that you are doing everything you can to urge a sleeping Municipality. Alas, Aosta, European City of Sport, in 2023 the Aosta Valley European Region of Sport. For a good four years - almost five - the Palaindoor has been removed from sporting activities and the world of sport. First used as a vaccination hub, then used for the issue of planning and to carry out the work to obtain the CPI. Three phases there too, an unprecedented bizarreness. Now two lots of work that have gone very slowly. Then the opening in fits and starts, rightly so, but there we spent quite a bit; we on this side, you urged on the other, in the end all outdoor sports managed to open (the tennis that is outside, the sport climbing and subsequently also the athletics structure). But at the moment it is still closed. Closed spaces, walls still not plastered, the closed refreshment bar, which is a fundamental element. There will probably be a delay there too because the refrigerated counters, which have been out of order for four years, will need to be changed. The fact that there is still no manager, despite the fact that the municipal administration has asked all the third sector structures to take care of this matter, is truly a great failure of this troubled legislature. We truly hope that Coni can take charge... At the moment ASVA has it. ASVA manages what it can manage because it has obviously entrusted it to the companies that can somehow carry out the activity. The truth is that that structure needs a manager. A capable and competent manager who must be financed because he cannot just stand there and collect the fees from sports clubs, federations, because we know that there is no money. It is still - we underline - a humiliation, for the entire world of sports, to have a structure that had been looked at carefully by all the Regions. "But how, in Valle d'Aosta did you do that thing there?". Yes, we have built a sports hall of that type, which is multipurpose, which is used for many sports activities. Unfortunately it has been closed for four and a half years and more. However, I thank you for your answers which were certainly exhaustive and gave us information, the ones we asked for. The hope is that we really move forward and I also look at the Sports Councilor, who I am sure will be careful to ensure that this thing is concluded as soon as possible. We know that Coni could be the one to manage it. There is nothing better than Coni to manage that thing, but it needs to be funded, because the money is not coming from Rome. We have been saying this right away.

class: EDILIZIA, Edilizia residenziale
name: Davide
chunk: Yes, he pointed this out to me. We had obviously asked the Municipality of Aosta for an answer, given that the question is related to an activity of the Municipality of Aosta and, among other things, was also the subject of a specific Commission meeting. Let's read it, returning to deal with that process of alienation of the 15 villas in the Cogne district for which the Municipality of Aosta announced a public auction notice in the spring. As we have repeatedly pointed out in this Chamber, the objective that the owner tells us remains that of identifying one or more buyers for those currently vacant homes and thus ensuring the start of the complex renovations that they require. As the proponent points out, the first deadline for submitting purchase offers was set for 28 June last and it was unsuccessful. In the following days, the competent municipal bodies had communicated, despite the absence of offers, that they had received positive feedback in terms of interest; for this reason, the Municipality of Aosta had decided to extend the effectiveness of the public notice of sale by a few months, a notice that was published under the same conditions and setting last September 30 as the new deadline for the submission of purchase offers. As I said and as agreed in a specific motion, in the meantime the Municipality of Aosta was heard by the competent council commissions, the third and fifth in joint session, to provide information and clarifications on the alienation project. With regard to the tender expiring on September 30, the competent offices of the Municipality confirmed to us that no offers were received with the new deadline. At this point, further evaluations and in-depth analyses are underway to help plan the continuation of the alienation operation.

class: EDILIZIA, Edilizia residenziale
name: Mauro
chunk: First of all, thanks for the answers that are certainly exhaustive and I didn't think it fell into that logic, but no controversy obviously. The Municipality told you "one or more buyers", the tender was made only for one buyer, a single subject who could purchase the 15 villas, so it can't be like that. The extension that then went deserted confirms what we had said: that it is not possible to continue in that direction. I don't know what the Municipality of Aosta will invent, but our managers at the Municipality will take care of it.

class: TRASPORTI E VIABILITÀ, Viabilità
name: Davide
chunk: The colleague asks us three questions regarding the situations that have occurred on the regional road number 20 of Gressan, a road that we have already discussed several times: it is the object of very significant traffic and also certified by the passages. Regarding the first two questions (whether reports have been received with respect to what is reported to us in the initiative and whether, if so, due investigations have been carried out to understand the reasons for the criticality), the attention on that stretch of road is high, as on the remaining regional road network, but on that one in particular. Also with colleague Lucianaz we have often discussed the regional topic of Gressan, Pont-Suaz, and this response is shared and the subject of... Following the discussion with the Municipality of Gressan. In relation to the recent event that occurred on a stretch of regional road number 20 located in the town center of the Municipality of Gressan, in the Chevrot hamlet, the competent regional structures have been informed of the incident and assessments are underway by the Regional Administration - as I said - in coordination with the Municipal Administration to identify possible actions to be taken in order to further improve road safety. Actions that follow those already undertaken, which we will answer in the third question. It should be noted, however, that along the regional road, which falls mainly within a town center with a speed limit of 50 km/h, electronic speed control had been activated, among other things, by the Municipality of Gressan in order to induce road users to respect the speed limit. The regularly tested equipment had been rented from an external company to which the Municipality had also entrusted the service of managing penalties under the Highway Code relating to speed detection. The automatic speed detection, which began in October 2023, continued until June. The service then, according to what the Municipality of Gressan tells us, involved the installation of a device that detected in both directions, in four fixed points of the territory, three of which along the regional road number 20 and along the regional road number 40. To detect the speed, the presence on site of a local police officer equipped with a tablet was necessary, therefore, in total autonomy from the company supplying the system. On the indication of the Council and after sharing with the Mayor, the services were carried out at least biweekly, sometimes triweekly, for a period of one hour, alternating the time slots with the result of a significant drop/reduction in the speed of vehicles along this stretch of regional road. This is what the Municipality of Gressan tells us. Starting from the month of June, the Municipality had to interrupt the detections in relation to the entry into force of the interministerial decree of 11 April 2024 which made changes to the rules for the use of speed detectors. English: Currently, therefore, despite the good results in terms of compliance with speed limits and therefore safety recorded in recent months, the service is temporarily suspended, pending the regulatory clarifications that have been announced. With regard to the third question (what further actions have been implemented in synergy with the local Administration to make this stretch of road safe), road safety, included in the 2020-2025 Legislature program, is one of the issues of attention by our Government. It should be noted that several maintenance and safety interventions on the road network, which we know has a length of approximately 500 km, are planned in the regional public works program 2024-2026 and are currently being implemented. Following the competition, even from Capo Cantoniere, it was possible to restore the six circles - once there were 8 and, due to staff shortages and retirements, it has dropped to 5 -; also the restoration of the sixth circle allows the Capo Cantonieri to have a better monitoring of what is the regional road network by dividing a smaller number of kilometers each. The regional road number 20 of Gressan, also taking into account the important vehicular traffic, has been affected in recent years by the implementation of several important interventions aimed at improving road safety. I will briefly list the main ones: construction of the roundabout, which we have already spoken about, at the intersection between regional road 40 and 20, then the construction of sidewalks alongside the regional road in the municipalities of Gressan and Jovençan, for a total of 3.5 km, construction of the roundabout between Gressan and Jovençan, construction of the roundabout between regional road 20 and regional road 47, as well as pedestrian paths in the municipality of Aymavilles. Also following these interventions that we have mentioned, it should be noted, on the safety front, that along the entire stretch of regional road 20, for the section of travel along the territory of the municipality of Gressan, the continuity of the sidewalk is guaranteed starting from the border with Charvensod up to the entrance to the Jovençan roundabout. The sidewalks continue, moreover - and we know this - on the territory of the municipality of Jovençan up to the edge of the town in the locality of La Fournaise. It should also be noted that important discussions are underway with the Municipality and other stakeholders to regulate access to some commercial areas with the possibility of inserting an additional roundabout in the La Borettaz hamlet, which will also allow the speed of vehicular traffic to be limited. Finally, it should be noted that, in the current year, maintenance work has been carried out on the road surface of numerous sections of the regional road 20 of Gressan, also in order to improve road safety, as well as - that was another of the objectives - to reduce the noise emissions with the laying of low-emission sound-absorbing bituminous conglomerate, in implementation of the action plan for the management of environmental noise on the regional road, which is the subject of the initiative.

class: TRASPORTI E VIABILITÀ, Viabilità
name: Andrea Fabrizio
chunk: Thank you Councilor for your response and for the wealth of details with which you obviously reported the actual state of the area. However, I believe that a reflection should be made on everything, that is, a series of things that you rightly mentioned, net of the maintenance that is there, and is right, and therefore falls within what can be considered the safety of a stretch of road, let's say that the criticality is above all the accident that occurred, as well as others that occurred some time ago; they are unfortunately due to the speed with which that stretch of road is tackled. That stretch of road is clearly a stretch that runs right through the middle of a residential area and that evidently draws its danger from here. What we were saying is this: if it is true that all these actions have been implemented, it is quite evident that they are not decisive and therefore it is clear that there is a need to take further steps. Coming, for example, to the issue of the detectors that were then temporarily put out of use, as we know, it was a regulatory intervention wanted with the new highway code, to prevent those devices - in our Region fortunately they are limited, but in other areas they proliferate and become ATMs for the Administrations, rather than a traffic control system - from undergoing hyper-fetations, let's call them that. What we were told, however - I think you will have been told too - with respect to the collection of signatures from residents in the area, is that traffic lights were in operation that were then deactivated and probably the traffic lights - but this is a municipal competence, that's why we then wanted to include the passage of synergy with the Municipal Administration within the initiative - if they were in operation, probably an additional deterrent would have been obtained. What unfortunately has resulted today is that we find ourselves having to deal again with accidents in the upper part of this stretch. What was then discussed with other colleagues is the problem of filling that stretch of road which, in my opinion, concerns another issue and that is how to unload, how to avoid overloading that stretch of road which is different. The problem is revealed more than anything at night, in the evening-night hours when visibility is lower, when traffic is certainly lower if not scarce, but the conditions of curves and poor visibility of the road sections clearly make crossing dangerous. It is clear that, if we find ourselves having to deal with a problem during the day where traffic needs to be speeded up and unloaded, and on this several proposals have been made to allow a direct connection to the state road; from the night front, early morning the time of the accident, which by pure chance did not turn out to be fatal, instead there must be guaranteed a presence that allows to avoid the repetition of these accidents, that this can be achieved either by restoring the traffic light or with an action of greater visibility and therefore the possibility of being able to have better visibility, also because it seems that the car that hit the pedestrian was going about 80 km/h, so certainly in that stretch of road with the houses in the area it certainly cannot be simple. Having said that there are different interventions that vary depending on the time and therefore how to clear that road during the day, in the morning or in the afternoon, and how instead to try to reduce the dangers instead in the evening hours and with conditions of less visibility, so I thank you for the insights that you wanted to provide us. Obviously we will now also do a check with respect to what you told us, also with the inhabitants of the area, to understand if these could be solutions that will be able to intervene on the problem.

class: TRASPORTI E VIABILITÀ, Viabilità
name: Davide
chunk: We return with colleague Baccega to talk about state roads, 26 and 27. Four questions. With the first question he asks us about the results of the discussion with ANAS, if it occurred: I confirm that last October 18th a meeting was held with the ANAS managers, in which the various topics were discussed again, including the topic relating to the safety of the stretch of state road 26 of the Municipalities of Quart and Saint-Christophe. The meeting had been scheduled for a few weeks previously and, given the importance of the topic, we confirmed it despite the fact that the Council was also working on it and was extended for an additional day on Friday. However, by postponing it, we would have lost precious weeks and so we managed to organize ourselves for this meeting. It was an opportunity to share some design solutions - and the meeting focused particularly on the issue of Quart and Saint-Christophe - that the ANAS technicians proposed to us. These solutions obviously require further study and discussion between all the parties involved in the implementation of the interventions, first and foremost the municipal administrations involved, the stakeholders present in the areas bordering the state road. An intervention that you, having held this role previously, know well and know the problems, know the urgency, but also the impact that this intervention will have on the territory. New meetings will be scheduled shortly, for which I have also asked for the availability of some colleagues in the Government, because it is an intervention that does have a public works management, but we know well that it involves trade, it involves transport, tourism, civil protection and many other actors. New meetings, therefore, are necessary to find a synthesis between the parties and identify as soon as possible the best design and implementation solutions to guarantee the safety of vehicle flows, without forgetting the need to ensure the passability and crossing of the affected road section also by pedestrians and cyclists. As I have already said on other previous occasions, the intervention is as urgent as it is delicate, so it is important to proceed with caution, but above all by opening the discussion, in particular I think of all the commercial activities that gravitate in that territory. It is a meeting, the one on the 18th, that had a specific focus on this dossier. Already next week we will meet again to also broaden the discussion on other issues. With regard to the second question (when will the ANAS Valle d'Aosta Focus be forwarded to the Regional Councilors, with the relative tables of the interventions that summarize the works planned in Valle d'Aosta, the works to be financed and the works already financed?), we are working with ANAS in order to be able to have the document prepared. ANAS is carrying out an important maintenance work on the state roads present in the Aosta Valley territory, with a view to ensuring easier and safer travel on them. These maintenance interventions can certainly generate, especially in the summer period, with the presence of tourists, some critical situations that we are trying to address and resolve. In order to increasingly limit these situations of discomfort, ANAS and the Region are actively collaborating with specific analyses of the interventions, their timing and possible solutions aimed at reducing the problems as much as possible. In this perspective, it is believed that, taking into account the imminent winter suspension of construction sites, ANAS can transmit a plan in the first months of next year that details the interventions to be concluded and the new interventions to be activated, also indicating a timetable for the works and any restrictions on circulation. This plan can be shared in this Council and in the Commission. Tomorrow with a further initiative on a roundabout we will return to the subject. On the third question (whether you have planned to involve the competent Commission for an in-depth examination of the interventions), I will certainly take care to involve the competent Council Commission, which I also thank for the continuous and fruitful collaboration, on the complex of interventions as well as on the new project for the safety of the stretch of state road 26. On that we had made a commitment that we have not forgotten and that obviously we intend to keep as soon as we have the documents that the ANAS technicians will provide us, obviously after that great important work of sharing. Fourth and final question: whether ANAS has been given an indication of the level of urgency of the intervention on state road 26 of the stretch between Quart and the entrance to Aosta. English: I confirm, also here, the evidence that the safety of that section in question is a priority for this Administration. This priority has been shared and reiterated to ANAS in the meetings held in recent months, last week, and in those to come, also in the presence of the two Administrations involved, who participated in the meeting which was also partly dedicated to the municipal Administrations. ANAS has also recently confirmed that the intervention requires a total investment of 35.65 million euros and is currently included in the ANAS Mit 2021-2025 program contract, which was approved with prescription and with resolution number 6 of 2024 at Cipess in the session of 21 March 2024, subsequently published in the Official Journal, general series number 160, on 10 July 2024. Available funding that today amounts to 24 million euros, of which 20 million from funds for new works and four million from the Convention funds. I therefore reiterate that I anticipated to ANAS the opportunity that, after sharing and approving the general design of the intervention, priority can be given - as we have already discussed here - to some functional sections of greater urgency; among these, in particular, the two roundabouts located at the traffic lights of the airport and the motorway junction. Therefore a design that will continue for the entire intervention, but then the will, which I believe was also shared, to give a certain priority, a certain urgency, to the two roundabouts.

class: TRASPORTI E VIABILITÀ, Viabilità
name: Mauro
chunk: This time we have clearer ideas, in the sense that, as we had already stated, the money made available at the time was not sufficient, we have arrived at a figure of 35 million and some in resolution 6 of 21 March 2024, right? If I understood correctly on the fly. The issue is this: that stretch of road is really very dangerous. Just last week there were two accidents, fortunately not serious, in the sense that there were no injuries or worse, however, two accidents that somehow slow down traffic, block the routes, some go to work late, others go to school with difficulty. Then there are the new pedestrians, who cross the road indiscriminately and it is very dangerous. The two roundabouts are fine, but a minimum of traffic island needs to be included, in this first intervention considered a priority. We are waiting for this project, we are waiting to see it in the Commission, as you said, but urgently request this route.

class: ASSISTENZA SANITARIA E OSPEDALIERA, Piano socio-sanitario regionale
name: Carlo
chunk: We answer the three questions in the interrogation, which are: whether it is possible that the Italian Ministry of Health has not received monthly data on the reorganizations of regional hospital beds referred to in the aforementioned decree, and above all whether the data has been correctly transmitted. Question no. 2: whether the ten hospital beds available in the triangle could be included in that table and whether they are currently used. Question no. 3: whether there is a way to streamline communication with the Ministry of Health and in general with the entire population, in order to avoid further unpleasant representations on the Health Plan in our Region, using the large PNRR funds made available by numerous programs for the digitalization of Aosta Valley healthcare. We confirm that the data published in the aforementioned press article do not correspond to the real situation of the provision of intensive and sub-intensive care hospital beds that, overall, are present in our health service. We confirm that the periodic monitoring feedback required by Legislative Decree 34/2020 has always been provided to the Ministry. English: We inform you that discussions are underway with the technicians of the Ministry of Health to update the Hospital Network Organization Plan approved with resolution 584/2020, including within it the beds that we have actually increased, as requested. In fact, the Region had been asked to achieve an increase of 10 additional intensive care beds and 9 additional beds for sub-intensive care. Regarding intensive care, 12 beds are currently available at the Parini Hospital in the resuscitation department; these 12 beds can reach up to 22 considering the 10 beds created by the commissioner structure for the health emergency (the so-called triangle) and then transferred to the USL Company by the commissioner structure itself. Therefore, with respect to the request for an additional 10 intensive care beds, our Region has, to date, achieved an increase of 12 beds, of which 2 in the resuscitation department and 10 in the triangle. , additional sub-intensive care beds have been created in the facility adjacent to the infectious disease pulmonology department. Therefore, in fact, our increase was equal to over 105% of what was requested by the Ministry. The published data therefore refer to the Hospital Network Reorganization Plan planned to deal with the pandemic and included the construction of a prefabricated building, C1, which was to be placed between the blood collection center and block C, i.e. the current location of the resuscitation department, and connected to the latter. It is precisely in this sense, as mentioned, that discussions are underway to update the aforementioned plan, for which we have requested and obtained a meeting with the Ministry, convened for November 12. The press reports do not take into account, therefore, the fact that in our Region the increase in intensive and sub-intensive care beds occurred using the beds created by the extraordinary commissioner structure for the health emergency. Although this situation has been communicated to the Ministry of Health several times, it has not been correctly represented in the press reports referred to. In this regard, we inform you that we have further represented to the Minister of Health the particular situation that characterizes our Region, requesting an integration of the data disclosed, so that correct and exhaustive information is guaranteed. On the other hand, it would seem simplistic to think that communications given to the Ministry can guide what the media freely publish. In any case, we agree that we have once again represented to the Minister - in a more timely manner than we had already had the opportunity to share in the meeting of November 17, 2023 - the fact that it is possible that the data that in general may emerge with respect to the health service of the autonomous Region of Valle d'Aosta do not always truthfully represent its reality. In this sense, in the meeting of the 12th, we will try to represent the above again and naturally the undersigned has rewritten to the Minister of Health. The only positive data, colleague Lucianaz, regardless of the fact that you and I enjoy telling each other what we think, is that, in fact, as far as intensive and sub-intensive care beds are concerned, regardless of the press reports that we tried to make sure were correct, we still obtained a 105% increase, so we went well beyond what we theoretically had to do, and this is a positive data for the community. Unfortunately, public opinion, the press and who decides to give the data and to whom, does not depend on us, even if we try to improve in this sense.

class: ASSISTENZA SANITARIA E OSPEDALIERA, Piano socio-sanitario regionale
