The fact that the two computer programs do not communicate may be a fact, I do not blame you, but it is certainly the regional structure that must provide this data to the Ministry on a monthly basis. You told me that on the 17th you will have a meeting with the Ministry, I hope that, with all the millions that this regional administration is investing in digitalization, a way will be found to communicate between computers so that the data is correctly reported. The press, in this case, has done nothing other than spread the updated table of the Undersecretary of Health, Marcello Gemmato, which he released this autumn; so in this case it is the Ministry that provided data, this data did not have, and today you explained to us a little why. That the Hospital structures have done their duty is sacrosanct, it is clear: they have created the places, the therapy is set up and works, so that is not the problem. The problem - and this is the spirit of initiative - is that the people of the Aosta Valley often and willingly find themselves classified at the bottom of the rankings, we are only above the Molise Region which has absolute zero, otherwise we are also at the bottom of this ranking, when instead money, work and commitment are spent to create structures that are in fact created. I therefore ask your Department, I ask the regional structures, I ask those who deal with IT, to see to communicating this data directly and correctly. That's all.

class: ASSISTENZA SANITARIA E OSPEDALIERA, Personale medico e paramedico
name: Carlo
chunk: English:What is the current situation in terms of availability and presence of general practitioners on site in the upper Valtournenche area, also with reference to the periods of greatest tourist influx. The ASL Company informs that from December 1st (therefore in view of the period of greatest tourist influx) in the Municipality of Valtournenche the outpatient activity will be guaranteed by a second doctor, in addition to the one already present. More generally, in the area of ​​primary care medicine, after years of work, studies and evaluations, last September 6th, in the Regional Committee of general practitioners, the regional supplementary agreement concerning territorial functional aggregations was signed. This is an important agreement, approved and made fully effective - a Copernican revolution, I wanted to say - by the Council with resolution 1160 of September 23rd, which lays the foundations for the reorganization of local medicine, also through the organization of work at future Community Houses, that is, at what were once called polyclinics. The discipline is in fact aimed at fully valorizing the skills and professionalism of the primary care physician in his unique role; in fact, alongside the ordinary activity of the family doctor, the so-called "choice cycle", based on the relationship of trust with the patient who chooses his own doctor, the hourly service activity is added, aimed at strengthening general assistance in the territory, thus guaranteeing a 24-hour service at what are the Community Houses and that is the former polyclinics. Therefore, primary care doctors, in addition to continuing their activity at the usual clinics, will also be able to provide services at the Community Houses, or polyclinics, where direct access clinics will allow patients to have a doctor who can respond to their health needs: hence the Copernican revolution mentioned above, also linked to the fact that general practitioners, in their centrality, will collaborate in staff with a whole other series of figures, health, social-health and social-assistance. Coming to the well-known national shortage of general practitioners, it is important to inform you that in our Region, in contrast to the national trend, we received applications to participate in the competition for specific training in general medicine for all ten places available and eight of them then showed up for the exam. Another positive signal is given by the training course that ended last October 29, which saw four trainees enter fully to support the Aosta Valley regional health service. Of these, three doctors, already assigned with the ceiling of 1,000 patients, will be able to expand their ceiling to 1,500 patients, thus guaranteeing further spaces of choice for our community. We are certainly aware that these numbers do not yet represent a full resolution to the need for family doctors, but it is a positive fact, as is also demonstrated by the interest shown in the degree course in nursing that saw the Aosta Valley, perhaps as the only faculty, with all thirty available places filled. It should also be noted that to ensure assistance, especially for fragile patients, two direct access clinics are active at the Municipality of Valtournenche, on Tuesdays from 10:00 to 13:00, and at the Antey-Saint-André clinic on Mondays from 14:00 to 17:00. Assistance to tourists in the summer period is guaranteed in the Valtournenche clinic by four doctors from 15 July to 23 August 2024, who ensure the activity from 8:00 to 14:00, or from 10:00 to 16:00. In the winter period, with a greater influx of tourists, assistance is also guaranteed through the activities that are carried out at the Trauma Center; always at the Municipality of Valtournenche, these services are added to the continuity of care, which was once called medical guard, active on weekdays in the time slot from 8:00 pm to 8:00 am and on pre-holidays and holidays with 24-hour coverage.

So I believe that soon we will have the incarnation of this proposal which, of course, being innovative in some ways, required a necessary study by all the subjects involved, both at the assessor level and in terms of health management. class: ASSISTENZA SANITARIA E OSPEDALIERA, Presidio ospedaliero
name: Carlo
chunk: , a part of phase 3, has provided for the new premises of the G3 building to be almost completely underground. Considering that the area is characterized by other plant networks under existing services, before starting the works, it was necessary to spend additional time to carry out the preliminary shifts on the electricity and gas networks. Since last September 16, the maximum number of bicycles that can park inside the Parini area is expected to be equal to the number of spaces present in the fenced area, i.e. 51 bicycles. The spaces are almost entirely located in the north-west area, on the corner of Via Chaligne and Via Parigi, where the shelter with thirty covered spaces is already present today, except for four spaces already present in the square near the entrance to the thermal-purification plant. The other spaces present and scattered in the area will all be relocated near the shelter, so as to arrange them in a single area for bicycle parking. The entrance to the area must take place with bicycles in hand via the pedestrian access for users, passing inside the guardhouse, block A. The route to reach the spaces must follow the internal road on the north side of the Parini Hospital. Once the maximum number of bicycles inside has been reached, any other bicycles will be directed to the multi-storey car park and outside the fenced perimeter. There are sixty-six other public indoor bike parking spaces that can be used by staff, given the proximity and direct connection to the hospital area, although they are not reserved for USL staff. The ban on access to the area remains for motorcycles. These provisions will obviously be updated in the presence of new circumstances that may cause interference with the safety of anyone passing through the hospital perimeter.

class: ASSISTENZA SANITARIA E OSPEDALIERA, Presidio ospedaliero
name: Andrea Fabrizio
chunk: Councilor, it is a real pleasure for me to discuss this initiative and I will explain why. First of all, last time you basically called us a few of those who don't understand anything, saying: "But it's obvious, there's a construction site in there, how can you transit with bicycles?". Note well: in the area you mentioned, that is where there is the shelter and everything else, there hasn't been any construction site anywhere, there hasn't been any construction site, none, I pass by regularly but the staff also pass by there every day and haven't seen any construction site. Since, after four months of this obligation, you also told us... when we presented the question, telling you: "it's absurd that you don't allow bicycles to be parked in the Hospital when there are spaces", you said to us: "But what's the problem? There are dozens, hundreds, thousands of parking spaces inside the Parini parking lot, so they can be put there". Then I hope I'm not bothering you too much with my reply, Councillor, and I hope it's not too much trouble if I talk to you... President, that's fine, let's call, let's do it, next time I'll give the same attention, do you think it's all normal? Excuse me, if I only ask for a minimum of attention. I'll do the same with two phones, maybe I'll turn my back next time when you answer me. I was saying, you told us that there were lots of parking spaces available, so we were fools who didn't understand how, in reality, one could park. No construction site was built, no passage was allowed, the external fence of the Hospital filled up with bicycles locked with padlocks, because all these hundreds of parking spaces that were there for bicycles were evidently not enough, four months later the ban was lifted on 16 September. We ask ourselves: "Why? It's probably because the construction site is already finished, the Hospital is in order, there will be the new Hospital and it has been finished". Actually, no, I read carefully and I see the internal communication of the USL that says: "As is known, every year the Municipality of Aosta adheres to the European mobility week", which will take place from what day? From September 16, exactly from when the regulation ceases to have any functionality, that is, practically until September 16th inside the Hospital you could not park your bicycle, then the European mobility week arrives and from the 16th the regulation is revoked and you can park your bicycle inside again. Coincidentally, but it must surely be almost a coincidence, on September 21st the cycle path of the Municipality of Aosta is inaugurated, but it must have been a coincidence for sure. Then you understand that the employees of the USL are not stupid, look, with their little bicycle they go inside, they have also equipped themselves with these things because unfortunately the city has been made unlivable by the cycle paths, they equip themselves with bicycles, they are prevented from parking them. Then the USL organizes the bicycle week, and on the very day that week begins, the regulation is revoked and from that moment on you can park, and now you come to tell us, Councilor, that in reality it is because: "Oh no, but the construction site has been made safe, so there are spaces". Councilor, but let's not kid ourselves, do things based on what you want to do, do things based on what is convenient for you, giving the most absurd reasons. This is a small thing, but it is the small thing that shows that perhaps someone is thinking they can call the shots. You said that in reality there is a certain part of the structure that does things independently, and we don't think so, it seems to us that instead someone perhaps wants to go in a certain direction, it seems to us that someone perhaps enjoys harassing the employees and when they are caught red-handed, and when they are made aware of the problems, then perhaps they wake up. However, this is a strange coincidence, Councillor, and I hope it will remain on record, and above all that whoever made this regulation then retired and saw it revoked, will know well the foolishness he committed.

class: ASSISTENZA SANITARIA E OSPEDALIERA, Azienda Regionale Sanitaria - U.S.L.
name: Carlo
chunk: Question no. 1: what has been the average expenditure over the last five years for the purchase of medical consumables by the Aosta Valley Health Authority? The ASL Company has communicated that, for the last five years, therefore the period 2019-2023 included, the average expenditure for the purchase of medical consumables has been equal to 8,935,133 euros. In more detail, the average expenditure has been equal to 8,269,216 euros for 2019; 8,934,097 euros for 2020; 8,459,369 euros for 2021; 8,717,358 euros in 2022; 10,295,623 euros in 2023, therefore also following the ever-increasing allocations given to our regional health service. Coming to question no. 2 (what is the procedure and which bodies are involved in the purchasing decision process for the material in question), the procedures relating to the purchase of medical material, in particular medical devices, are governed, as you can imagine, by the public procurement code which, in the 2019-2023 period, has undergone periodic corrections, until the adoption of the current new procurement code pursuant to Legislative Decree 36/2023, by the Prime Ministerial Decrees of 24 December 2015 and 11 July 2018. These Prime Ministerial Decrees, respectively, identify and integrate the product categories of goods and services for which, pursuant to Legislative Decree 24 April 2014 no. 66, the national health service bodies are required to use Consip Spa or other aggregating entities, therefore Single Procurement Centres, in carrying out the relevant purchasing procedures. Therefore, the USL Company uses codified procedures in the activities of programming, design, assignment and execution of contracts for the purchase of medical devices, procedures that transversally involve all the administrative and healthcare structures of reference. In this procedure, the USL Company is closely supported by the central purchasing bodies, namely Inva Spa first and foremost, as the regional reference body and aggregator for the product categories referred to in the above-mentioned Prime Ministerial Decrees, and by other national central purchasing bodies through adherence to framework agreements, i.e. codified contractual methods for the optimization of purchases. Coming to question no. 3 (what are the post-purchase quality verification procedures for the material in question), the structures in charge of the purchasing procedures regularly interface with the healthcare structures that use the purchased medical devices. The pursuit of the result in healthcare purchases cannot ignore a continuous comparison between the party using the goods and the party that takes care of the purchase. This comparison is aimed at optimizing the exchange of information relating to both the need and the type of use of the goods in question. Any situation of discrepancy between the quality of the purchased good and the good received is reported to the purchasing structure by the user structure. This determines the activation of a comparison between the purchasing structure and the supplier company, a comparison aimed at resolving any non-conformity of the product. This phase may determine, in some cases, also a replacement of the product that does not meet expectations with another product and, where necessary and permitted by contractual regulations, also the replacement with a product from another supplier. We also highlight that the structures that use medical devices maintain a constant dialogue with patients and patient associations, and in this sense it is important to underline that their opinion, as direct users of the devices, is also taken into consideration as far as possible. This naturally applies to all associations, including diabetics. To the above, for completeness of information on the subject, we finally add that the attention to the quality, functionality and above all the safety of medical devices is also guaranteed by the activity of the network for device-vigilance that involves the Department, the USL Company and the competent representatives of the Ministry of Health in continuous discussions, comparisons and exchanges of information, always to protect patients and guarantee care.

class: ASSISTENZA SANITARIA E OSPEDALIERA, Azienda Regionale Sanitaria - U.S.L.
name: Paolo
chunk: Of course, it is a complex topic, even delicate in some ways, which I have also had the opportunity to address on a professional level. First of all, it is important to underline how significant the expenditure is, because you told us - now I took some notes very quickly - an average expenditure of almost 9 million per year, with over 10 million exceeded in 2023, so we are talking about truly significant expenditure for the community. As regards the purchasing procedures, it is clear that there are constrained procedures that have administrative procedures that must be observed, so we know about Consap, we know about these bodies that sometimes proceed to make purchases, through tenders perhaps autonomously, other times by associating with other bodies. The substantial problem is then precisely that of post-purchase control, that is, once the material and devices are applied and used by healthcare workers, there is probably some criticality there, because it is true that there will be a device-surveillance network, the fact that you tell us that the various interested parties interface regularly, I don't think it is always so easy to interface with the supplier companies when perhaps they are from Taiwan or who knows where, because this has already happened, so I think it is quite a significant problem, this. What has been reported to us of course by medical workers, and not only, is that sometimes these materials are quite poor quality, and I understand that it is not always a direct responsibility of the bodies that are part of the Health Authority, because in fact, as we were saying before, there are procedures to follow, sometimes you join up with someone else, who knows, who buys plasters or syringes, and then your package arrives and you take note of what has arrived, of course. Perhaps, however, from what has been reported to me, that there is not this immediate reaction, therefore these verification procedures and continuous interfacing that you have told us about... in my opinion, but I say this very cautiously, of course, because judging the work of others is always easy, but sometimes you are wrong, but I believe that this procedure could be improved in this respect. I reserve the right to return to this point again after having done some further research and having carefully read what was your response.

class: ASSISTENZA SANITARIA E OSPEDALIERA, Azienda Regionale Sanitaria - U.S.L., ASSISTENZA SOCIALE, Disabili
name: Carlo
chunk: Question no. 1: to know if it has been planned to implement every useful action to free up the aforementioned parking spaces, identifying alternative spaces for company cars. The aforementioned parking spaces are disabled parking spaces at the Via Guido Rey site. The ASL Company informs that at the polyclinic on Via Guido Rey, work is underway to build what will become the Aosta Community House, which, as is known, will be funded by PNRR funds and there is no need to represent the urgent timescales for this type of project. The works, among other things, are aimed at creating a new access to the facility with an operation to remove architectural barriers for all categories of users: disabled, elderly, visually impaired, etc. These activities, which we are aware cause some temporary inconvenience - coming to the previous question, the fact that you think I could be so diabolical as to establish the entrances and exits from a construction site like that of the G3 things, in some ways also makes me feel much stronger and more powerful than I am -, have required a reorganization of the parking spaces for employees, for employees with disabilities and for disabled users. The current works have in fact significantly reduced the number of internal parking spaces between the company buildings on Via Guido Rey. The Company informs that three dedicated spaces have been created for disabled users who need to access the polyclinic; the other spaces are intended for company cars and the operators have been made aware of their correct use. Users in possession of the blue coupon for disabled people can also park for free in the blue spaces or in the spaces reserved for disabled people on Via Guido Rey. We trust that at the end of the work in progress, a comprehensive and satisfactory allocation of parking spaces can be restored to meet all needs, from those of companies to those of users and, even more so, those of disabled users.

class: ASSISTENZA SANITARIA E OSPEDALIERA, Azienda Regionale Sanitaria - U.S.L., ASSISTENZA SOCIALE, Disabili
name: Andrea Fabrizio
chunk: I would like to clarify for a moment what the issue is. One day I happened to be passing by that very street, namely Via Guido Rey, and I was called by a disabled person who had to park there, and who actually found the parking spaces completely occupied by USL cars, moreover I also published a photograph that proves it.... I know you know, but I will also quote the article, don't worry. I take note of this parking lot and therefore I take a photograph to testify, because perhaps if I hadn't had the photograph they could have also told me that I was making things up, and obviously, since there was no Regional Council, I thought it appropriate to publish everything, so that perhaps something would move. Now imagine my dismay when I read exactly what you just told me, that is, the USL responds: "According to what was reported by the USL Company", this is the article that was then made following an interview requesting explanations, "the temporary use of the internal parking lot, between number 1 and number 3, is reserved exclusively for users and employees with a blue coupon certifying their disability" and so far so good, then there are three words: "and company cars". You see, Councilor, I understand everything, the needs of the PNRR and we need to finish everything, but imagine being a person with a disability and having a place under your house, where you park your car. You arrive and can't find your place, do you know why? Because someone who has to move house has arrived, parked his van there and says: "Okay, but this is a place for people with disabilities" and also for vans if you want to move, because unfortunately I have to do it urgently, so it's not like I can just stand here and wait. Now you will understand that this explanation to the person with disabilities will certainly not be enough, because it is clear that if a space has a very specific sign, which is the one reserved for people with disabilities, it is not a space reserved for USL service cars. That space is reserved exclusively for people with disabilities. There is no construction site, PNRR or construction site that can overcome this obstacle. The fact that you stubbornly defend the USL line that says that service cars can park there is simply shameful and disgusting, since you deal directly with disabilities. Anyone who deals with disabilities and tolerates that company and USL cars can be parked in spaces exclusively intended for disabled people, and justifies it with reasons of urgency, is objectively not doing their job, they are doing it very badly. Very badly therefore, Councilor, very badly for the USL offices that justified this to you. Moreover, I would also like to say one thing: there are works of the PNRR financed with millions and millions and millions of public money and a person who stopped for a moment to think: "Mumble, mumble, mumble, but where can we put the machines when this space is occupied?" was not there, they thought of something completely different, except where to put the cars and how to allow disabled people and people with disabilities to park. Moreover, people with disabilities are the first to be angry, because they can't find a place and it's all well and good to say that you can park with a ticket even in blue spaces; it's true, but there's no room, that's why there's a courtyard with a bar that's reserved for people with disabilities who go there to get health services. Objectively, Councilor, this explanation doesn't satisfy us at all, in my opinion the conduct of the USL and the management of those spaces is absolutely shameful. We remain convinced of this and obviously the issue doesn't end there.

class: ASSISTENZA SANITARIA E OSPEDALIERA, Personale medico e paramedico, ORDINE PUBBLICO - FORZE ARMATE, Pubblica sicurezza
name: Carlo
chunk: English: Before answering the questions raised on the topic brought to your attention, we believe it is necessary to briefly recall the recent provisions adopted with Legislative Decree no. 137 of 1 October 2024, containing "Urgent measures to combat the phenomena of violence against healthcare professionals, social healthcare professionals and auxiliaries of assistance and care in the exercise of their functions, as well as damage to goods intended for healthcare". As is known, this Legislative Decree has made some changes, even to the Criminal Code and the Criminal Procedure Code, and has included severe penalties in the event of damage to healthcare and social healthcare facilities and in the event of attacks on healthcare personnel. This is to say that the topic of violence and aggression, given healthcare personnel, is - unfortunately - very current and has such a scope that it is necessary to proceed with provisions to stem, as far as possible, the phenomenon. The problem, therefore, is of a community nature. Coming to the questions raised in the question: no. 1"The number of episodes of violence against healthcare workers at our healthcare facilities in the last year and the places most subject to such episodes". The number of verbal and physical attacks recorded in 2023 at the healthcare facilities of the Local Health Authority is increasing compared to the annual data recorded in the three-year period 2020-2022. Based on the monitoring carried out, the episodes of violence committed at the facilities of the Local Health Authority against healthcare and social-health professionals in the exercise of their functions in 2023 are in fact 32, compared to the 18-20 annual reports referring to the three-year period mentioned above. The facilities most involved are psychiatry, with 25%, the emergency room, with 13%, and the territorial area, with 15%. In relation to the current year, considering the data processing period between 1 January 2024 and 30 September 2024, 28 assaults were reported, 14 of which involved the psychiatry department. In evaluating the data, the peculiarities of the users who access the mental health department must be taken into account, of course. As regards the other hospital departments, however, there has been a decrease in the number of reports of the episodes in question, which generally amount to one or two cases per facility. Coming to question no. 2, "The measures adopted at the regional hospital and the facilities in the area", the Usl company, starting from December 2022, has adopted a new company software, called "Talete", for the management of clinical risk. With the launch of the new IT program and with the awareness and training campaign for healthcare personnel, there has been greater attention from the personnel themselves to proceed with the reports. The ASL company also has a specific procedure in place that provides guidance for the prevention of acts of violence against Aosta Valley ASL company workers. The aim is to provide all workers with the necessary guidance to recognise aggressive verbal and non-verbal behaviour, in order to prevent situations of tension from degenerating into episodes of violence and, in this sense, measures are suggested to workers to reduce the risk of aggression by users and to spread the practice of immediate use of reporting tools for any episodes of violence. The staff of the preventive medical and risk management structure of the ASL company collaborated with the strategic management in reviewing the company information contained in a poster placed in the common areas of the company itself, in order to inform and raise awareness among users of the possible consequences of aggressive acts. Ministerial recommendation no. 101 was also published on the company website and distributed to healthcare workers. 8, i.e. the recommendation to prevent acts of violence against healthcare workers, aimed at preventing acts of violence through the development of measures that allow the elimination or reduction of risk conditions present in the healthcare context, in addition to the acquisition of skills by workers in assessing and managing such events. Finally, the preventive medicine structure and the risk management of the Usl company report that the data cited above are related to reports received via company software. It is not possible to know how many resulted in complaints to the police. At the Department of Mental Health, the Local Health Authority has activated a private security service with a deterrent function, as these are structures that are more at risk due to the characteristics related to user problems. At the emergency room of the Parini hospital, the police force is present from Monday to Saturday, from 7 am to 1 pm. On holidays and at night, the service is covered by on-site surveillance. Finally, we inform you that the competent structure of the Department is working with the Local Health Authority to establish at the regional level, in accordance with the regulations in force on the matter, the Center for the management of health risks and patient safety. In this way, those activities that the Region already currently carries out in the area of ​​recognition and communication of risks and adverse events will be formalized and made structural.

class: ASSISTENZA SANITARIA E OSPEDALIERA, Personale medico e paramedico, ORDINE PUBBLICO - FORZE ARMATE, Pubblica sicurezza
name: Erika
chunk: Certainly worrying data but, as you said, very probably increasing, also due to greater information and therefore also to a report, perhaps, made by the operators, compared to past years in which it was not done. From the data you provided us, surely many of these are linked to the users, because, if we talk about the psychiatry department and the emergency room, we are very likely to find ourselves in cases of this type. It would perhaps also be interesting to understand how many of those reported cases were in the facility perhaps for phenomena of alcoholism or drug addiction, because perhaps, also from this point of view, it would be interesting to understand the reasons for the attacks: if linked to pathologies and to a specific user or if instead linked to tensions that can arise, perhaps due to long waits or for other reasons. Since the presence of a software was represented to us - and I imagine that data of this type is also put in that software - perhaps we will access the documents to better understand what the reasons for these attacks are.

class: ASSISTENZA SANITARIA E OSPEDALIERA, Personale medico e paramedico, ASSISTENZA SOCIALE, Assistenza socio-sanitaria
name: Carlo
chunk: English: With regard to the outcome of the discussion with the political party, it should be clarified that the reorganization of the staffing plan was naturally adopted independently by Jean Boniface Festaz, with a resolution of the Board of Directors dated August 13, and was then approved by the regional government, with resolution no. 1188 of September 30. The redetermination of the staffing plan is part of the necessary expense management process, a process requested by the Region, which the company is pursuing. With regard to the technical assessments that led to the determination and reduction of staff, we report what was reported by Jean Boniface Festaz. The company recalls that in the previous allocation there was no presence of health services (which were introduced with the amendment made by regional law no. 12 of July 29) and that in the social-health services the employees referred to the professions and operators of health interest assigned to the services of a more social-health nature were assigned in a cumulative manner. The number of OSS, which constitutes over 60% of the total employees, has been, in its complexity, reduced from 75 to 78 units, identifying the number of operators assigned to each of the three types of services: nursing home with protected and protected plus type service, social-health with the temporary residential number for dementia and health with the community hospital soon to open, the equipment of which is indicated in the project of specific interest between the Region, the Usl and the Jean Boniface Festaz, shared with the trade unions and approved with resolution no. 824/2023. Here it is useful to specify that the number of OSS has been reduced compared to the previous one operating in the RSA-UAP service, in compliance with what was defined in 2023 also with the trade unions, with respect to the return of personnel temporarily placed in service at the Usl company, pending the completion of the community hospital. The J.B. Festaz confirms that it has safeguarded the staff with the resources indicated in the organizational chart in addition to the minimum standards required at national and regional level, with all the permanent employees already employed in the former RSA-UAP. In this case, it is absolutely useful to inform that, as regards the minutes per person which are expressed in 120 minutes, the J.B. Festaz is around 170 minutes per patient, therefore well above the minutes required by current legislation, and that also in terms of service provided, in terms of cost or investment in the people who are at the Jean Boniface Festaz, we are well above the standards of the protected and protected plus regional. As regards the dementia unit, in the socio-health OSS service, the OSS resources indicated are those currently operating. Compared to the OSS operating in the socio-welfare service of the nursing home - the largest in terms of employment is 69 beds - the J.B. Festaz is around 170 minutes per patient, therefore well above the minutes required by current legislation, and that ... Festaz explains that it has produced and used the scientific model that defines itself as a professionalizing care model. The company then emphasizes the application of the model that avoids staff replacements for absences under 60 days, a measure aimed at containing costs (for which a commitment was made with our letter of February 20, 2024, to clarify the 2024 budget forecast) which, after being introduced as an experiment, has entered into force in a definitive form. The change, which is also minimal - one resource in the number of OSS assigned overall to the sub-departments of the nursing home - is essential and functional to guarantee internal substitutability without resorting to additional contracts for replacements. This therefore generates not increases, but reductions in personnel costs and minutes provided, while still guaranteeing assistance well above the minimum prescribed, which is why I have just now represented this great respond of minutes to Jean Boniface Festaz, without a significant impact on the quality of the service provided, thanks to the optimization process underway. Regarding the reduction of units in the auxiliary services area, this concerns the concierge service which, with the technological modernization of the company telephony, no longer has the function of hub for all incoming calls, which are now direct, and will therefore be able to see a more limited operating time than the current one, with the consequent savings. In order to consider the possibility of reassigning OSS staff with limitations to the role of concierge, the nursing home reports that there are currently no vacant positions in the concierge service and that the hiring mentioned in the initiative is related to temporary coverage that became necessary in relation to a not brief absence of a person in permanent service. I will now answer the questions relating to the initiatives of colleague Aggravi. With respect to the conciliation attempt initiated by the unions against Jean Boniface Festaz, the regional offices of the competent prefectural services have communicated that the same, following the meetings held, had a negative outcome. As you know, the Councilors cannot participate in these conciliations at the prefectural offices. However, it is useful to clarify that in the context of the discussion the management of the company J.B. Festaz expressed its willingness to proceed with a competitive procedure for the hiring of nurses and that, starting in 2025, it will be possible to allocate additional resources for staff replacements. The company also reported that two of the six vacant OSS positions in the social-assistance services area will be stabilized shortly, while another four positions are covered by permanent staff, temporarily assigned to the nursing home and who will transfer to the future community hospital. Responding to any meetings between the trade unions, the nursing home and the regional counterparts, as specified above, the social partners and the governance of the nursing home met within the scope of the conciliation attempt procedure mentioned above. Although not a direct party to this formal procedure - as was further clarified to all those present at the conciliation table - we nevertheless met with the social partners last October 29, as requested by them, considering it useful to clarify to them the path that led to the recognition of extraordinary resources to the nursing home over the last six years. I believe, as also attested by the same trade unions, that the meeting was also fruitful to clarify the important regional commitment made to support the care activity of Jean Boniface Festaz. In fact, we went from approximately 2.7 million euros granted in 2018, six years ago, to 5.2 million euros allocated for the current year, only for the social-care part. As regards the social-health services, until the end of August 2023 the Usl company had two agreements in place with the J.B. Festaz company: one relating to the RSA UAP service and one for the Alzheimer's and dementia unit. The first ceased at the end of 2023, when work began on the construction of the community hospital, while the second is still effective. For the RSA UAP service, the Usl company provided the J.B. Festaz company with 5.2 million euros. Festaz approximately 1.5 million per year, for the Alzheimer's and dementia unit the expenditure committed by the Usl company is equal to approximately 300,000 euros per year. In light of the financial difficulties communicated by J.B. Festaz in the year of the review procedure of regional law 34/2004, already started by the two departments of the Department, it was necessary to intervene urgently and as a priority on article 12, concerning the assets of the sources of financing. The need to update the financing regulation of J.B. Festaz was made explicit in the resolution of the Regional Council 346/2024 approving the three-year budget 2024-2026 of Festaz and in the resolution of the Regional Council n. 624 of 3 June 2024 approving the 2023 budget of the J.B. Festaz company. In these documents it was announced that the revision of 34/2004 was underway and that, as part of this revision, it was planned to modify the financing mechanism, in order to ensure adequate additional financial resources also for the social and health services provided by the company. Therefore, these changes were made in the first variation of the 2024-2026 budget forecast approved by this Council. More precisely, in analogy with the interventions already effective for social and welfare services, a co-participation in the operating costs relating to the health services (future community hospital) and social and health services (dementia unit) was introduced, up to a maximum annual amount of 35% of their amount. This contribution, financed with regional resources, will be provided by the Usl company within the contractual agreements in force with the J.B. Festaz facility. The approved measures provide for a maximum financial commitment in the regional budget of €400,000 for the year 2024 and €1,300,000 for 2025 and 2026. Still regarding social and health services, it is important to add that, in parallel with the interventions for contribution to operating costs - first with article 5 of regional law 27/2023 and subsequently with article 22, paragraph 3, letter i) of regional law 25/2024 - specific extraordinary compensation measures have been provided for the providers of accredited private social and health services. These measures, financed with regional funds and provided to the service managers by the Usl company within the scope of the existing agreements, are intended to contribute to the increased costs determined by the general increase in operating costs, including the costs for the next rounds of contract renewal. In this sense, the J.B. Festaz was paid an amount equal to 79,354 euros by the Usl company. Likewise, the general provisions for proceeding with the liquidation of the compensation for the 2024 financial year will also be approved. As the numbers make clear, the intervention was enormous and unprecedented. Colleague Aggravi, you are a person who not only pays attention to numbers, but also has a memory of numbers. After such a detailed response, there is certainly a need for a small summary. From a political point of view, this Council and the government in the last 18 months have made an intervention for the Jean Boniface Festaz which, from a social-welfare point of view, has seen, both for 2022 and 2023, the maximum amount of expenditure made available; with the intervention made then with law 12/2024, however, for the first time a classification of personnel has been made, in a clear and distinct manner, with respect to health and social-health functions. This, as just highlighted, will go to financial interventions in 2024 of 400,000 euros and in 2025 and 2026 of 1,300,000 euros. To those 5.2 million euros that we talked about, which were only 2.7 million in 2018, these expenses will also be added. From this we subtract the interventions that have been made in an extraordinary manner for the contract renewals and the interventions that you have requested in terms of investment, for example with regard to the 500,000 euros allocated for the famous water pipes. At this time, therefore, something made clear also by the right questions that have come from the trade unions, this Council and subsequently also the government, both in the action implemented by my predecessor, colleague Barmasse, then continued by the undersigned, we have arrived, in terms of social assistance, to allocate the maximum possible, with an extraordinary contribution in the amount of 1,600,000 euros. The per capita quotas have gone from 115-125 euros per person to the current 130-140, therefore also the sum of these per capita quotas has turned out to be, at this time, the highest possible; all this without providing for transfers for the social-health part. Having also changed the 34/2004 and having institutionalized the fact that in that facility, which has some of the highest minutes in the Aosta Valley, for each person who is assisted there is also health coverage that is not available elsewhere and having also provided for a financial allocation, which is what I have just mentioned, I believe that all of us can say that the effort made for the Festaz is certainly a concrete effort and that it has already happened.

class: ASSISTENZA SANITARIA E OSPEDALIERA, Personale medico e paramedico, ASSISTENZA SOCIALE, Assistenza socio-sanitaria
name: Andrea Fabrizio
chunk: I almost feel sorry to interrupt this communicative idyll that has been created between the Councilor and his colleague Aggravi. Unfortunately, since there are two inspection initiatives to be discussed together, it has to be interrupted. Obviously I thank you for your response, net of a mistake that you made when you spoke of a reduction that goes from 75 to 78 units, perhaps it was the other way around, from 78 to 75. You said this, before, I would just like to ask for confirmation that it was just a mistake. Obviously I thank you for the response, which essentially unloads the critical issues on the reduction of staff on the choice of J.B. Festaz, which tells us that you have simply taken note of the request from the structure. It is clear that in the question we had presented we also asked about the outcome of the discussion with the political party; you say that the discussion with the political party is not planned, but in reality it took place, because we know it, and we also know about the irritation of the unions that there was in discovering this cut. If we had to summarize a bit the meaning of the answer you gave, we could say that everything was done in a workmanlike manner, that the minutes are obviously even higher, that we have exceptional treatment and that therefore that staff was almost surplus to requirements. Then you motivated this cut with an economic necessity, due to the critical issues that the structure reports from this point of view. I limit myself to observing the fact that, in our opinion, the solutions to be adopted could have been different, even though I think that they will have duly informed you - if they have not informed you, I will inform you - that a person who has worked in the structure since 2012 resigned yesterday. This can only highlight that there are problems in the structure, that critical issues among those who work there are unfortunately felt and that a climate of this type certainly does not help to carry out one's task, which unfortunately requires a lot of attention, with the necessary serenity. With respect to the suggestion of placing OSS staff in the concierge functions, he also tells us that this is a fixed-term contract, for an absence that will be quite long. I believe that, rather than depriving oneself of staff, perhaps the choice of placing people in another function... because it is not clear: you said that now we have everything computerized, so you no longer go through the concierge, but then the need to have a person in the concierge is there again, so it is not clear which of the two is actually the most popular thing. We note with regret the situation that has come to be created, especially because, if people who have worked in that structure for decades end up doing actions such as resigning, there are probably problems. Our concern is that in reality these critical issues and these tensions are not unloaded on the users, unfortunately, who, in the end, are absolutely blameless for all this. We therefore urge you to pay greater attention to the choices that will then be carried out with respect to the structure, so we take note of your response and await the evolution of events. Above all, we will discuss with the staff to evaluate what the next steps will be.

class: ASSISTENZA SANITARIA E OSPEDALIERA, Personale medico e paramedico, ASSISTENZA SOCIALE, Assistenza socio-sanitaria
name: Stefano
chunk: More than a communication idyll, as colleague Marzi knows, colleague Barmasse and colleague Baccega also know, it is not the first initiative I have presented for Festaz; like colleague Guichardaz: she too perhaps does not have a communication idyll, because with her colleague it is not exactly a communication idyll. We are happy that you too, colleague Manfrin, appear when you hear the sirens of the unions. Welcome to the club. Having said that, in light of the current situation - and I certainly do not want to criticize the size of the commitment that the administration is making towards the nursing home - I would instead like to go back a bit. I also mentioned the other previous Assessors, if I forgot anyone I apologize, I excluded the interims because objectively sometimes it is complex. Having said that, there are two major problems relating to that reality, which I was already trying to explain in a very modest way even before the topic of the community hospital arose. There is a problem of financial structure - in fact the interventions that the Councilor spoke about are today an attempt to solve a problem that in reality does not arise today, but that arose previously - and on the other hand an organizational level problem. Allow me to make a consideration made by the man in the street: certainly the high playing time compared to other realities is a good and right thing, or it could be, because the man in the street could say that there is a higher playing time because there is a higher organizational need than other realities, therefore the organizational problem persists. The cooling and conciliation procedure is a plastic representation of the organizational problem, as I think there could also be a further problem - and in part it had already emerged in all the initiatives that the various colleagues have done - in the sense that those who are no longer at Festaz today, and have been moved, do not want to return to Festaz, therefore we have a further problem and we know very well what was the complicated area for moving, I have no other term, transferring or in any case allocating those human resources elsewhere. We therefore have a further problem and the weight of the replacements is there. The fact that with new funds it is then possible to carry out a procedure to increase the organic plant, among other things approved by the Usl company, is a further run for cover. The two problems, therefore, in reality persist. On the part of the financial structure, certainly the summary - and I thank you for the summary you have made - allows us to understand what the financial magnitude involved is, which burdens the governance of the nursing home with a further and greater responsibility and perhaps, as they would say in industrial economics, it is better to concentrate on the line, rather than on the administrative staff, and it is obviously necessary to also reduce the stress that exists in the organizational sphere, which then is or can be discharged on a better quality of service, a service that in any case has been, as we often rightly point out, always of quality. Now we have also learned that there will be a further union meeting. What we hope for is that there can be, on the one hand, a resolution to this high temperature, given that the procedure is a cooling-off, but that, beyond the individual procedures provided for by the laws that regulate union relations, there can be an internal, organizational cooling-off, above all useful for being able to have a resolution, perhaps not definitive, but that allows everyone to work in a more effective and more cohesive manner. We also hope that there can actually be a definition of the procedure relating to the executive body, therefore also to the General Management, in such a way as to better understand how the management will be managed. Certainly, unfortunately, it will not be the last initiative, but it is a set of initiatives, of which I think you can also appreciate the coherence and the attempt to resolve the problems. It is not a sporadic initiative.

class: ASSISTENZA SOCIALE, Famiglia, tutela dell'infanzia
name: Carlo
chunk: "If I know the bonus in question, if so, what is the reference body for receiving the application". With reference to the first question, i.e. whether the competent Councillor is aware of the bonus in question, the answer is yes. It is a tariff relief for domestic customers aimed at reducing the cost incurred for the supply of electricity to families in which there is a member who is in physical difficulty and who requires electromedical equipment to maintain life. The matter is regulated by the decree of the Ministry of Economic Development no. 28 of December 2007, which provides, in article 4, that the customer in possession of the requirements set out in the previous article submits a specific request to the Municipality of residence. The Municipality of residence, also through the IT support made available by the Ministry of Economic Development, evaluates and accepts the applications, upon presentation of the certificate issued by the local health authority to which they belong, attesting to the serious health conditions of one of the members of the family unit, such as to require, in fact, the use of medical-therapeutic equipment necessary for their existence in life and powered by electricity. As reported above and as also clearly reported on the institutional website of Arera, the competence to receive the applications is therefore of the Municipalities of residence and not of the Region, which does not even have, as written in the question, any function of collector of the applications, not having access to the IT system for the transmission of the same. To submit the applications, the Municipalities can also sign a onerous agreement with the tax assistance centers (CAF), by virtue of an agreement specifically signed between the Anci (National Association of Italian Municipalities) and the National Consultation of CAF. The text of the question refers to applications that were rejected by the Municipalities of residence of the interested parties and by the CAF, but without further details, which would have allowed a direct verification with the identified Municipalities. In any case, in a collaborative perspective, the offices of the Department of Social Policies have activated a discussion with Celva, receiving reassurances that this is indeed a competence of the Municipalities of residence of the interested parties and that Celva itself will send a note to all the Municipalities, reminding them of the ownership of this procedure, naturally copying the Department itself. The same offices of the Department of Social Policies have then also activated an informal discussion with a CAF, receiving as a response that the CAF are indeed authorized to receive and transmit applications for this measure, subject however, as mentioned above, to the stipulation of an agreement to this effect with the interested Municipalities.

class: ASSISTENZA SOCIALE, Famiglia, tutela dell'infanzia
name: Andrea Fabrizio
chunk: Thank you, Councilor, for your absolutely precise and timely response. I would like to point out that, hearing your response, someone might imagine that some competence has been attributed to the Region; in reality, this is unfortunately what some Municipalities have responded to, that is, some Municipalities have passed the responsibility for receiving the applications partly to the CAF, partly to the Region. It was therefore not clear, since the instructions are very clear on the Arera website, why there was no choice to collect these applications. I thank you above all for the awareness-raising part that was implemented with Celva and at this point we hope that it will no longer happen that responsibilities are passed between local authorities and, possibly, CAF or regional administration, because in this way the procedure will also be clear, so we will also be able to communicate to the families - unfortunately there are several dozen who have communicated this problem to us - that the issue is resolved. You rightly said that we did not indicate the Municipality: we did so deliberately because, as you know, the censorship that this Council often applies is very serious - some people long for it - but if we had also included more precise coordinates to identify which administrations had not provided adequate answers, had not taken charge of the questions, we would have risked unleashing "so it is that person, it is that other one, let's discuss in secret or not". So we cut to the chase and only highlighted a situation of discomfort that, I imagine, with the communication you announced to us will evidently be overcome. Thank you for your response.

class: ASSISTENZA SANITARIA E OSPEDALIERA, Personale medico e paramedico
name: Carlo
chunk: Regional law 27/2023 provided for a temporary health allowance for the three-year period 2023-2025 for all non-medical veterinary health management and health professions, for the personnel of the health professions in the health sector, excluding nursing staff, who already benefited from the allowance under regional law 22/2022. This law also extended the allowance to all health personnel, including those under regional law 22/2022, even with part-time employment. The overall financial burden for the three-year period 2023-2025 was determined at 2.7 million euros, according to the calculations provided by the Usl company. The USL company then started the company-wide supplementary bargaining, establishing, in agreement with the trade unions, to pay the beneficiary staff the same monthly amounts as per regional law 22/2022, rather than, of course, the amounts proposed by its own bill, no. 65, which in fact instead provided for lower amounts to be paid than 22/2022. The amounts of bill no. 65 therefore - in a political bargaining that saw you, colleague Restano, and the government, arrive at finding an absolutely profitable solution for these employees - had naturally been calibrated with respect to the amounts mentioned above. The trade unions in fact agreed on the possibility of proceeding, however, to a balancing payment by the end of the year, if it were necessary to respect the total amount of the financing approved by law, which was precisely 2.7 million euros. In recent months the company has therefore been proceeding with the planned balancing payments. It is therefore not a question of a reduction in the temporary health benefit due to lack of funds, but of an ordinary accounting operation foreseen in the context of the union agreements that were signed within the company, linked to a balancing procedure. In short, when the union representatives and the company then had to apply, in a foreseen location, the application according to the amounts of 27/2023, it was in fact foreseen that there would be balancing if by the end of the year the money would be more or less; always within the maximum limit of 2.7 million. Before proceeding with the answers to the individual points of the question, it is important to clarify that the data provided concern the categories of workers contemplated by law 27/2023, which therefore excludes temporary staff, full-time doctors and nurses. Let's come to question no. 1, "How many new hires were made by the Aosta Valley Local Health Authority during 2024, referring to non-medical health management and health professions excluding nursing". The new hires made by the Local Health Authority during 2024, up to October, referring to non-medical health management, were 3, while those referring to health professions, excluding nursing, were 2. The terminations recorded by the Local Health Authority during 2024, up to October, referring to non-medical health management, were 2, while those referring to health professions, excluding nursing, were 13. "Whether there were discussions with the company before proceeding with the adjustment". The adjustment was made without providing for discussions between the Region and the Usl company, as these are not provided for, but established exclusively within the scope of the company-wide supplementary bargaining with the trade unions, so even what you reported during the discussion of the DEFR was absolutely relevant to what happened, but naturally all of this did not refer to what had been established when 27/2023 was applied, where it had already been agreed that the adjustment would be made by the end of the year. This amount was defined at the time on the basis, in fact, of the data provided by the competent structures of the Usl company, precisely within the scope of the company-wide supplementary agreements stipulated with the trade unions, both in the health sector and in the management of the health area. It was agreed that the payment of the allowance would take place through the recognition of the amounts established provisionally, therefore respectively in 350 euros and 800 euros; this, without prejudice, precisely, to the redetermination of the same within the month of December of each year, to guarantee compliance with the spending constraint. To protect everyone, with respect to the legitimate nervousness that may exist on the part of colleagues, the commitment that the government is making already in 2025 is to increase the allocation for 2025 of 27/2023, also thanks to the reports that have arrived.

class: ASSISTENZA SANITARIA E OSPEDALIERA, Personale medico e paramedico
name: Claudio
chunk: I thank the Councilor for the answer, to which he could have dedicated only one minute, as it turned out. He used the rest to explain to us in great detail and to summarize the situation. This question is preparatory to the discussion of the motion - which I hope will be discussed today - to which you have already given a partial answer, saying that the commitment of the Council is to finance what is missing for 2025. I therefore think that we will have the opportunity to appreciate the vote in favor of this motion. Having said that, allow me just one point: the proposed law on allowances was from 2022, I'll tell you the date, spring 2022. We waited a year for the majority to define all the procedures to arrive at recognizing this allowance, which is due for healthcare workers. The calculations that had been made at the time, in May, were completely different. Having said that, we appreciated that in negotiations the unions arrived at defining a different figure. This was the negotiation, evidently something did not work, or the reduction was already foreseen. We will have the opportunity to discuss it when the motion is discussed. For now, I thank you for all this data, let's take note of the number of terminations and the number of hirings, which will be very useful for (incomprehensible).

class: ASSISTENZA SOCIALE
name: Carlo
chunk: "What are the technical reasons why the PD for the assignment of the task of drafting a feasibility study aimed at the participatory review of the system of regional interventions of policies to combat gender violence does not include any indication regarding the fight against discrimination based on gender identity and sexual orientation?" Question 2: "Whether another study has been assigned for this specific topic and with what indications". Question 3: "If not, whether it confirms that the bill that should be ready by summer 2025 will also include provisions for combating discrimination based on gender identity and sexual orientation". Question 4: "Whether the delivery date of the aforementioned study can be brought forward". As has already been said several times in this chamber and as you have also pointed out, the process of reviewing law 4/2013, which considers the feasibility study to be necessary, has been operationally underway since last August. In answering the first question, a summary and generalized phrase was used in the executive order, which therefore does not go into detail. We confirm that the study, as we requested, will contain prevention, contrast and support interventions, in favor of women victims of violence, with or without minor children, and of those who suffer violence and/or are discriminated against and persecuted by virtue of their gender identity and sexual orientation. These are important aspects that we agree must be taken into consideration and that we believe should be included in the future framework law, as we have already stated several times in this chamber. In answering the second question, it goes without saying that no other task has been assigned to another subject, since the topic is already, as mentioned, included in the broader task mentioned above. With regard to the third question, it is confirmed once again that the new text of the law will also include what has been recalled, that is, any form of violence, which must be condemned. With respect to the delivery date of the study, we must bear in mind that the same - built in a participatory manner through the involvement of various bodies, subjects and actors in the territory - requires the appropriate times already envisaged. In any case, attention will be paid to the methodological process and - even if the presentation of the new rule before the summer of 2025 is not considered possible today - everything possible will be done to bring it forward. The times for sharing with the appointed subjects - colleague, you can easily understand this - cannot be imposed, because otherwise their participation would in fact be lacking. In fact, with a directive and imposed approach, the method that these times rightly impose would be called into question in this way, given the sensitivity of the topic we are talking about. We don't want to make you angry and reopen a whole series of issues, but we need to understand each other: if we apply the time variable to methodological and participatory processes, either we impose them and therefore remove the methodological part, or, as you might rightly say, if we let it go, at that point our intention could be to extend them. I understand perfectly, so I have absolutely not had a paternalistic attitude, I could not allow myself to do so towards you, I simply recall the final part of the previous discussion: fifteen days ago, on this topic, you very clearly highlighted that I was making you angry about this topic. This is the reason why, I say it right away, I am dwelling on this part of the process. I have absolutely no intention of limiting your ability to get angry with me, I can even understand that, but coming to the more technical and procedural aspects, the fact that in August, as we also exchanged informally, the mandate was given to arrive at this study which is the subject of the question at point no. 58 of this agenda of the Regional Council is absolutely not a process either to lengthen the times or to shorten them. It is simply that, if you want to arrive at the constitution of a framework law, the reference process, which among other things also arrived from the territory and which also fits in with a complex national legislation, which is not giving particular indications on this issue... if you want to take into consideration, from a methodological point of view, a participatory system, an administrative process that is not practically stepping on the accelerator at a national level, you must, consequently, find a fair balance between respect for a method that must take into account the demands of the territory and the time needed to ensure that, rightly, no one can think - because that is not the case - that we are trying to slow down these times, on the contrary. The choice (which was made by the Department, even before the undersigned arrived, and then by the undersigned, together with the V Commission and also together with your legitimate demands on this issue) makes it clear that there is absolutely attention. I have no intention of making anyone angry and I have no intention of getting angry when I am used as a scarecrow for those who want to slow down these regulatory processes, because that is not the case. At the moment in which one chooses, even in respectful terms, the administrative dictates of shared administration, which a decree-law has well identified by the Italian State, I believe that in fact those times of sharing must be respected, because I believe that the territory must participate in giving indications on such important issues in order to provide adequate solutions.

class: ASSISTENZA SOCIALE
name: Chiara
chunk: Councilor, the question arises from a very simple situation: in the last Council meeting you told us that it was your intention to bring the revision of the law to the floor in the summer of 2025, when we will be in the final stages of this legislature, and then you told us that an assignment had been given. I looked for this executive measure from the month of August and I must say that, when I read it, my dismay, which was already evident in the floor, increased, because the text makes no reference to the part related to discrimination based on gender orientation. Now you tell me that the sentence is summary and generalized, but the sentence is this: "A study aimed at the participatory review of the system of regional interventions of policies to combat gender violence". Nothing else is written. You say that the right timing is needed, that a participatory process is needed and that we must not impose forced marches on associations and all those who want to give their contribution. I, Councilor, remind you that the other time I spoke to you about three years because I was referring to the path of the legislature, but let's stick to the period in which this Department is led by you, so from March 2023, if I'm not mistaken: in May 2023, so we're talking about about a year and five months ago, we were summoned, since a year had already passed since the filing of our proposed law, by the Department and we were told that there was the intention to review the law, the review of the law was underway and there would be room, in that review, also for the rules that we were requesting at the time. Now the assignment for the study was given in August 2024 and you say that time is needed. I understand that time is needed, but we know that this review is underway, at least that is the right date, from May 2023. So the years increase, the months don't increase, the years increase. English: Consequently, from May 2023 - when we were informed that the revision of law 4/2013 was being carried out, to today, and then to August 2025 - more than two years will have passed. The fact that the process of participation of the associations requires such a long time - and then obviously it is not only the time of participation of the associations, but also of the drafting of the study itself - seems to me not to be a desire to slow down the times, I am not saying that you are slowing down the times, what I am telling you is that you are not speeding up the times, they are certainly not being speeded up. This is clear for all to see. I also believe, I know this, that the associations that intend to participate in this process do not need to develop particular and specific requests, because they do not know the reality, they know it very well and they know that there is a need to move forward quickly. What proves it - the need also comes from reality - is that the situation in Valle d'Aosta, I'm talking about gender violence, has worsened, so it requires, also from the legislative side, not only from that of the police, a commitment, which must be additional in terms of timing. The other issue concerns discrimination based on gender orientation, which is not mentioned in the executive provision. I accept what you say, you confirmed to me that this will also be included in the law. I note that you did not mention ableism, so it means that then this will not be included, while we had understood that it should be included. I think I perceived, at the end of your speech, a willingness to try to push for shorter times. I sincerely hope that is the case. As for getting angry, Councilor, perhaps you should worry that I don't get angry because, being the Councilor for Health, if I have a fit I will also be a burden on the health system.

class: CASA DA GIOCO
name: Mauro
chunk: Let's go back to talking about poker at the Casino of Saint-Vincent. In June we had asked the Council to understand if it was the intention of the casino, as other casinos in Italy already do - I am talking especially about Sanremo, which was the first, but now also Campione - to proceed with the organization of poker tournaments also in Saint-Vincent. Aware that these tournaments do not bring the so-called spending customers closer to the casino, but that in some way they promote admissions to the casino and in any case feed income, even if they are not so significant, and in any case create a strong increase in takings for the related industries, that is, for hotels, restaurants and above all for trade in general in the area. Also and above all on the basis of what was discussed in the last City Council of Saint-Vincent, where it was emphasized that the town's trade is in trouble, the same goes for Châtillon, and the convening of a single-issue Council on the crisis of the situation of trade in the area was requested. The resumption of the casino is certainly a positive element, especially for us it is very pleasing, but events and demonstrations of appeal that go well beyond just the day are required. We have received news of an assignment for the organization of new initiatives and new events. I have news that the first event that was organized, dedicated to the music of the Beatles, was a great success, so the resumption, in harmony with the casino and the territory, can and must go above all in that direction. The poker tournaments are certainly an attraction and a positive element that will attract from 3,000 to 6,000 people, this is clear. Given that the participating company has sent an adequate procedure to present an expression of interest in the organization of poker tournaments in Saint-Vincent; highlighted that the deadline for the presentation of expressions of interest expired on September 30; since we have no news, we ask the government if it is aware that three expressions of interest have been presented - we read this from the Gioco News newspaper - and in what time frame it is intended to proceed with the assignment of the management of the organization of the tournaments as well as when the first poker tournament in Saint-Vincent can be started.

class: CASA DA GIOCO
name: Renzo
chunk: With regard to the first question, based on information from the casino, it is confirmed that three applications have been submitted and that the company bodies have already made an initial assessment. In these cases, the company implements the provisions of the current Purchasing Regulations, which provide that, in the event of a public notice of supplier selection, the selection is carried out through the establishment of an assessment committee, consisting of at least three members. At the end of the work, the committee will define the list of admitted candidates with a qualitative assessment and deliver it to the company management, for any due diligence, technical and economic, and subsequent commercial negotiations, which will include the analysis of the applications submitted (both in terms of form and merit) and the identification of the contractual scheme and the operational project. In this specific case, this project will subsequently be the subject of information to the regional administration for assessments relating to the regulations governing the relationship between the Autonomous Region of Valle d'Aosta and the Casino de la Vallée. English: With regard to the second question, "In what time frame do you intend to proceed with the assignment of the management of the organization of the tournaments", the gaming house always informs us that the times for proceeding with the assignment of the management and organization of the tournaments are not foreseeable at the moment. Furthermore, a company was the victim of a very serious leak that led the Gioco News magazine to publish, on October 2, 2024, confidential information regarding the position of the three candidates who submitted the application and to express evaluations of merit on the same candidacies. It is emphasized that the deadline for submitting the application was set for September 30 and that before the publication of the Gioco News article, the commission responsible for analyzing the candidacies had not yet met to evaluate them and that therefore the relevant documents should not have been available to any employee of the company. The gaming house has opened an internal investigation, aimed at clarifying the events and, in any case, will proceed with the cancellation of the procedure, evaluating the methods and terms of the new expression of interest. The facts described are also the reflection of manifestations, on this topic, of an incongruous attention, media and otherwise, which interferes with the autonomy of the company and weakens its decision-making capacity, consequently also delaying the start of new projects. As regards the third question, "When will it be possible to start the first poker tournament in Saint-Vincent", the start of poker tournaments will therefore depend on the conclusion of the supplier identification procedure and the analysis of subsequent organizational problems. It is worth remembering, as already said on other occasions, that, despite having an interest in the topic of poker tournaments, the Casino de la Vallée company has not yet committed itself to their organization because the same, which has significant start-up and commercial investment costs, has not been included in the industrial plan approved within the context of the bankruptcy procedure in progress. In this regard, it is recalled that, pursuant to the ruling of the Council of State, section III, no. 2973, dated May 17, 2018, the organization of poker tournaments cannot be entirely entrusted to a third party, with the company remaining responsible for the management and control, payment management and participant registration, naturally with the related costs.

class: CASA DA GIOCO
name: Mauro
chunk: I start from your last statement: in reality the Campione casino and the Sanremo casino have started poker tournaments, there is certainly a path that can be taken, because I do not believe that they do poker tournaments outside the law. The other element of your response is extremely worrying and I invite you to provide us with information. I will stop here with respect to the reply because it does not deserve anything else, but it is absolutely worrying and the hope is that the gaming house can have the appropriate information as soon as possible to ensure that this path can restart with the maximum possible rules.

class: FINANZA REGIONALE E LOCALE, Finaosta
name: Stefano
chunk: To introduce this interpellation, I will start from the guidelines containing the application discipline of law no. 20 on subsidiaries, adopted with resolution no. 1591 of 14 December 2022. Within the guidelines, article 5 expresses a principle: although public participation does not change the nature of the company as a private entity, the public nature of the sole or majority shareholder entails significant derogations from the general discipline and it could not be otherwise due to the nature of the capital employed, which comes from the community. It is a ruling by the Autonomies section of the Court of Auditors in 2021. In the context of the consolidated text of participating companies, in particular Article 19 - and the principles are contained in this resolution - reference is made to the fact that publicly controlled companies establish with their own provisions, criteria and methods for the recruitment of personnel, in compliance with the principles, including those of European origin, of transparency, publicity and impartiality, and there is a reference to Legislative Decree 165/2001. I quote this passage because I will return to it in the final part, hoping to have the time, given what I have to try to represent.
