Finaosta has adopted and effectively applied the provisions of the consolidated text, as well as of Law no. 20 and, obviously, on the basis of these guidelines it has adopted a regulation for the recruitment of personnel, always in consideration of the guidelines relating to 14 December 2022. I don't know if there is much to laugh about... but I'll move on, hoping that you will listen to me. In light of this, the guidelines tend, precisely, to indicate the need for subsidiaries to equip themselves with these regulations. In the same guidelines, at point C, in the context of the selection procedures for the recruitment of the managerial profile, it is stated: "The selection procedures for the recruitment of managerial staff are always open" - in full compliance, precisely, with the TUSP - "Without any possibility of making vertical career progressions, classification in a higher qualification towards the managerial area, due to the different applicable discipline, notably deriving from the different level of bargaining, as well as from the different role and qualification compared to the area immediately below". I simplify: manager against manager, no question. But there is another step that we must consider: point H of the same guidelines, "Hiring of the general manager", where provided for, obviously. "Due to the peculiar high level of professionalism and activity carried out by the general manager" - which, in the context of Finaosta, I recall, is not only subject to the TUSP, but also to the much more stringent Bank of Italy policy regulation - "Of company management and organization, as well as the necessary relationship between this and the governing body of the company" - the general manager himself in financial companies is an executive body, who has a very particular relationship and is not only the head of the organization, but is an even more particular manager - "Companies controlled directly or indirectly by the Region must establish" - always in reference to the TUSP - "That the general manager is hired on a fixed-term contract". It is then said, in the context of this point, and I will only dwell on the first words, that "In the context of an open ordinary procedure the procedure is external". It is true that the following point B provides for exceptional procedures, but it says: "In a completely exceptional manner with respect to the ordinary procedure, controlled companies are given the possibility of proceeding, by assigning the role of general manager to an internal manager deemed to possess the requirements for the role itself, in compliance with the provisions set forth in the applicable collective agreements. In any case, the Board of Directors is required to provide adequate motivation regarding the possession of the requirements required for the assignment of the role. Please refer to point C for procedures". There is a fact, and I'll get to the point: in light of these guidelines, the staff recruitment regulation was adopted. At the top there is the Constitution, then there is 165, with the TUSP, then there are the guidelines that the Region, the shareholder, gives to its subsidiaries, then there is the company statute and then there are the regulations. It is a sort of increasingly stringent funnel. The staff recruitment regulation states: "The company, on the basis of the staff needs and the recruitment plan approved by the Board of Directors to identify the profile sought, carries out a preliminary check on the possibility of drawing on currently valid rankings. If this is not possible, or the verification returns negative results, the company activates a specific selection procedure". But not only that, in the final part of the regulation it says: "Without prejudice to the provisions of the relevant national collective agreement, for the hypotheses of assignment of higher duties, for the coverage of non-managerial work positions" - therefore all non-managerial human knowledge - "Created ex novo from those made vacant" - but we are talking about non-managerial - "Can experience specific internal progression procedures, and disciplines them". Having said that, for everything that is managerial - I repeat - the regulation is more stringent, because it is a form of funnel compared to the guidelines - procedures must be experienced, obviously as provided for by the regulation itself and, in general, by the guidelines and the legislation that I have cited. In light of this, we question the President of the Region to find out: "What are the reasons that led the regional financial company today to proceed with an internal progression for the replacement of the resigning general manager"; "What other internal progressions will have taken place following the changeover at the General Management, or within the scope of the so-called organizational solutions cited in the Finaosta press release, within the scope of the declarations made upon the announcement of the resignation of the General Manager"; "Whether within the scope of the choice made by the company, as cited in the previous point, there have been discussions with the company and, if so, with what results and, if not, why they were not started" and "Whether the President of the Region deems the choice made by the Board of Directors of the Finaosta company to proceed with the replacement of the General Manager with an internal progression procedure to be acceptable, compared to the methods chosen at the time for the appointment of the resigning person". I hope the President will not be offended, but the delegation to the subsidiaries is, after all, to the effective owner of the entire regional administration.

class: FINANZA REGIONALE E LOCALE, Finaosta
name: Renzo
chunk: The colleague has already done the regulatory analysis, I will limit myself to answering the questions that have been asked. Moreover, I believe that those in charge have made their decisions and assessments on the basis of the regulations in force, of this I am confident. With regard to the first question, that is "What are the reasons that have led the regional financial company today to proceed with an internal progression for the replacement of the resigning general manager", Finaosta informs that, with regard to point 1, the motivation on the basis of the identification of an internal resource for the purposes of the rotation of the general manager lies in the fact that said resource, in addition to possessing all the suitability requirements requested for the position in question, has been able to develop a high level of knowledge of the company's processes and dynamics, as well as of the resources in the workforce. Furthermore, the same, in carrying out the governance activity in the business area of ​​the company, has confirmed full alignment with the company's strategic directions. These elements represent an important added value, clearly not found in external candidates, given the need to ensure immediate continuity in the company's operations. At point 2: "What other internal progressions will take place following the changeover of the General Management, or within the so-called organizational solutions cited by the President of Finaosta S.p.a. in the statements made upon the announcement of the resignation of the General Manager". With regard to point 2, Finaosta highlights how the rotation of the General Management will be accompanied by the establishment, reporting directly to the General Management and with powers to replace it, of a coordination department of the so-called "Staff Division", including the organizational units that are not directly involved in the credit process and the obligations relating to administration, accounting, finance, supervisory reporting and management control, as well as the establishment, reporting directly to the departments referred to in the previous point, of 2 additional departments: on the one hand, the governance department, "Services and studies", with the function of supervising operations relating to the human resources function, the organization function, the information systems service, the newly established studies and advisory service, the Coa service, the legal service, general affairs, the regional regulatory consultancy service, the data protection office, internal contact; on the other hand, the "Participations" department, with the function of supervising operations relating to the Participations office and the strategic consultancy service. The organizational solution decided upon - in addition to ensuring that the company's operations can continue without interruption - aims to pursue two main objectives, considered fundamental for maintaining the current levels of performance over time, both qualitative and quantitative. The first translates into identifying a top management ready immediately to assume the operational leadership of the company, with full alignment with the strategic directions identified by the shareholder and the Board of Directors, both to guarantee the maintenance of the directions identified, in order to achieve the objectives assigned to Finaosta in terms of positioning and development of the services provided for the benefit of the regional socio-economic fabric. The second, accessory to the first, but no less important, leverages the time factor. In order to achieve medium-long term strategic objectives, it was deemed necessary to identify resources who, due to their work experience, can guarantee solid and lasting leadership of the company. Finally, and more generally, it is highlighted that the solution is an appropriate alignment of the structure to the main canons of corporate organization, which suggest that the same, where possible, take into account an adequate distribution of responsibilities attributed to the top operational bodies. This is answered by the identification of three new management figures, who will act, not only operationally, in support of the General Management. With regard to the third question, namely "Whether in the context of the choice made by the company, as cited in the previous point, there have been discussions with the same, if so, with what results and if not for what reason were they initiated", it is confirmed that, since this is a reorganization with a marked strategic value, the organizational solution was previously brought to the attention of the shareholder, who confirmed full trust in the administrative body of the company. English: For the fourth question, "Whether the President of the Region deems it acceptable to choose the Finaosta Board of Directors to proceed with the replacement of the general manager with an internal progression procedure compared to the method chosen at the time for the appointment of the resigning director", the fourth question seems almost posed at the level of personal curiosity, or as a sort of analysis of satisfaction. I can safely answer that the correct and effective discussion with the presidency of Finaosta concluded with full and broader confidence in the fact that the choice had to be an unconditioned expression of the President of the financial company and its Board of Directors. If I have to express an opinion, however, I fully share and appreciate the same in guaranteeing, first of all, full and immediate operational continuity, which other options would not have guaranteed. This must be added to the personal esteem for the person in charge who, from what I have had the opportunity to appreciate and for what my evaluation, which is not due, is worth, is a serious, motivated, passionate person, as well as technically prepared and competent.

class: FINANZA REGIONALE E LOCALE, Finaosta
name: Stefano
chunk: I'll start from the end. The last question can be dismissed as personal curiosity, it is certainly an uncomfortable question, but those who have great responsibilities sometimes have to answer uncomfortable questions. In reality it was much simpler: why was a selection made previously and not today? Above all I ask myself a question... I say this because the other time it was you too, President, so I evaluated this, there was no other person. This question was asked, I received the answer, fine, I take note of it. The fact is this: two aspects were represented in the answer. I will summarize one like this: you rightly said that the top management had to be ready immediately to respect the objectives assigned by the Region partner and then you also made it a question of timing. Very well, but I ask myself one thing, in a provocative way: how can an organization be promptly active in responding to the objectives assigned by the Region partner, if it does not respect the directives that the Region partner gave it, with a resolution still in force, until proven otherwise, but above all not respecting its own internal regulations. Because the issue is this: often the participating companies - rightly so, especially for those with a private organization - complain about the great bureaucracy of governance that the Region does on them, but if a regulation is adopted by the same company, why is it not respected? The real problem is not all the discussion I made previously on the regulatory sources, but it is simple, two lines! The Finaosta regulation, which I understand is still valid, says something even clearer. Excluding a whole series of possibilities, why has it not been respected? This regulation does not even provide for the emergency solution, which instead is eventually provided for in the guidelines. This is the absurdity. Don't turn the question on people, because I could also say that on some occasions external selections did not allow the participation of internal resources, who during the life of Finaosta have grown and could bring their experience and the work they had already done. Instead they were not able to participate in those selections, because in the announcement it was foreseen so, among other things for positions inferior to that of the role of general manager. I repeat: I did not write this regulation, nor did the regional administration write it, Finaosta wrote it. So I say to myself: how can we say today that there was a need to have a prompt response to respect the objectives assigned by the Region partner, if then an in-house subsidiary company, that is, an arm of the administration, does not respect the regulations it has given itself? I am worried.

class: AMMINISTRAZIONE REGIONALE, Ordinamento degli uffici e del personale
name: Andrea Fabrizio
chunk: As President Testolin will remember well, we had already addressed this issue a few sessions ago. This issue had emerged in all its virulence when some unions, together with numerous political acronyms, which I believe have never existed in history - I believe they are acronyms composed of a single person, probably - had published a leaflet, on the intranet dedicated to the employees of the Region, against differentiated autonomy. This had already allowed a whole series of political evaluations on the merits. A particularly questionable phrase had also been inserted on this leaflet, where it was stated that "Saying no to differentiated autonomy meant defending the Constitution born from anti-fascism as a struggle and as a value that the fascists in government today want to dismantle". If differentiated autonomy also gives us the possibility, possibly, in the face of the opening of a table, to also expand the possibilities for our Region, probably, President, you will be a little fascist too. If there is the possibility of modifying our Special Statute, she will probably be a little fascist too. Maybe she will have to be careful and watch her back a little from the unions, but we will see what the path will be - regardless, that's for sure. The thing is that we found it in extremely bad taste, so much so that a series of protests had come out and, in the face of these protests, the unions, whining, had then removed this poster to replace it with another national one. I had then presented an interpellation on this topic. The curious and amusing thing is that - in response to my request to have greater sensitivity, greater attention to what was published - she had responded in a way that was absolutely understandable, saying that she would then sensitize the structures, that the structures had already taken steps to sensitize for a more focused use of the union noticeboard. Imagine my shock when I see that the same union, the main signature that had signed this manifesto, then issues a press release against my interpellation and publishes it on the union noticeboard. We asked to raise awareness to put on the union noticeboard only those communications that have a union relevance and the union issues a press release and, instead of sending it to the newspapers, publishes it on the intranet noticeboard, to respond to my interpellation. My interpellation is anything but union-related, obviously, but it is a political inspection act. Here we can absolutely exclude the fact that it is focused. The funniest thing, however, is that on the one hand the union provides an excuse for the removal of this flyer, saying that the press release on the noticeboard had a "natural course of publication" and the natural course is that they published it, realized they had made a blunder and deleted it. That was the natural course, so this thing is dead, but they say that it was a natural course because they organized it, but they recall, regarding the possibility of publishing these documents on the union noticeboard, Article 1 of Law No. 300 of May 20, 1970, otherwise known as the Workers' Statute - still in force, we understand - which establishes the freedom of expression of thought in compliance with constitutional principles. Basically they claim the right to publish whatever the hell they want. In reality, in the citation of this article of the Workers' Statute there is a piece missing, because it is actually written in Article 1 that "Workers, without distinction of political opinion, union membership and religious faith, have the right, in the places where they carry out their work, to freely express their thoughts in compliance with the principles of the Constitution", but then there is another little piece: "... and the rules of this law". Because the Workers' Statute also provides a series of rules. What do the provisions of this law say about the ability to publish something on the union noticeboard? In Article 25 of the same law we find the right to post, which says: "The company union representatives have the right to post on specific spaces, which the employer is obliged to prepare in places accessible to all workers within the production unit, publications, texts and communications relating to matters of union and labor interest", not the entire world, human knowledge, the shopping list, grandma's photographs: texts and communications relating to matters of union and labor interest. Let's start by saying that I am not a public or regional employee, and yet I have access to everything that has been published because the regional employees - there are usually some who are not left-wing, or are not unionists - are particularly annoyed by the continuous publication of these things, so they rightly give us the right information, and it must be said that we can actually say anything, but we cannot say that a press release sent to respond to the undersigned is a matter of union and labor interest. Mine is a political inspection initiative, a union's response is absolutely legitimate if sent to the newspapers, but putting it on the employees' intranet noticeboard... objectively does not deal with any union or labor matter. In addition to this, however, imagine the further dismay when, again the same unions - not the least bit affected by the fact that perhaps that tool is not the most suitable for addressing a certain type of issue - think of publishing this nice flyer against the "Security" bill, to announce a nice demonstration. In this flyer, the signatures appear again, in addition to some unions, also of the National Partisans Association - okay, I look at my colleague Guichardaz, who just passed by - of the Italian Communist Party, of Communist Refoundation, of Valle d'Aosta Open - regarding my colleague Guichardaz, who is marching behind us - and another acronym that is too small to identify, but I imagine that it tends to be more or less of the same type. It is always red, it has red and white writing, maybe I will ask my colleague to interpret them. I see this objectively as a sense of impunity, indeed, almost of contempt, of mockery, with respect to the rules that they themselves, that the unions themselves cite in their press release, made to respond to the undersigned - I repeat: you are completely free to do so, it does not concern me in the least - who however does not respect the provisions that the law provides. I believe that someone, perhaps convinced that what is done with certain political activities, that is, cloaking a political action with "apoliticization", "non-partisanship", associationism - because that's what it is: a political action - has thought that one can be clever by publishing one's political communications on the employees' noticeboard. I'll add one more chapter. If the noticeboard were something that could be consulted specifically, that is, I go in and I don't see anything, if I don't go specifically to look at the union noticeboard, it wouldn't be good anyway, but it would be less serious all in all; but the problem is that this noticeboard appears precisely when you enter your intranet, the employee's, it's the first thing that appears. If I want to go and see something, I am inevitably attracted by this. That's why with this interpellation, Mr President, I ask you if you intend to prepare a regulation to govern the publication of communications on the employees' intranet noticeboard, in compliance with what I mentioned to you, namely Article 25 of Law No. 300 of 20 May 1970.

class: AMMINISTRAZIONE REGIONALE, Ordinamento degli uffici e del personale
name: Renzo
chunk: I'll start with a joke, in the sense that if, after a month, the hopes we had formulated have fallen in vain on both sides, it's not as if there was that much sharing. In short, we are here again to talk about it, it's our job and we do it with the correctness of always. It is also mentioned in the interpellation, I remember what Article 25 of the Workers' Statute says: "the company union representatives have the right to post on special spaces that the employer is obliged to prepare in places accessible to all workers within the production unit, publications, texts, communications relating to matters of interest to the union and work"; it could probably be considered an excess of democracy, but there are some significant words within this provision, which say "right to post" and "obligation to prepare". That's the rule. As already stated on the previous occasion, the employer, the Region in this specific case, is obliged to make available a space, which has now become virtual and issues verified access credentials to those who operate on this space, as we had already stated last time. It is not responsible for the published contents, as this is material created and managed by third parties, nor can it unilaterally prevent or remove the published material. The interpellation asks "If it is intended to prepare a regulation to regulate the publication of communications on this noticeboard". Having the certainty that the interpellation does not intend "Discipline" as a synonym for "Censor", because it would not be possible, it is noted in the meantime that a regulation in this area should be agreed with the same trade union organizations. Secondly, some regulations on the subject, available online, have been examined and what appears evident is that they are essentially declarations of principle, which take up the Workers' Statute, collective agreements and framework agreements, always underlining the aspect already mentioned, that is, that the responsibility for the contents lies entirely with the subjects authorised to insert them. More generally, the responsibility is not recalled in relation to the contents of what is published, but with regard to the possible violation of Legislative Decree 82/2005 (i.e. the digital administration code) and Legislative Decree 196/2003 (i.e. the code on personal data protection). The only other significant provisions then concern the prohibition of using the notice board for personal purposes and the setting of time limits, generally between 60 and 90 days, after which the texts must be removed, if they do not remove them first. There is no provision aimed at identifying what is of interest to the union and to work, given that it would all be very questionable and this could be considered an unjustified limitation to the right to post. These, therefore, are the parameters within which any regulation of the use of the union noticeboard on the intranet site of the Region should operate. In any case, I will ask the Department of Personnel to start this discussion with the union organizations, even though I have some doubts that this meets the overall expectations of the interpellation, because it will probably not resolve what is requested. I conclude with two small reflections. The first is that it is possible that, thanks to this interpellation, the union noticeboard on the intranet page of the regional site has had an increase in consultation and will certainly be of interest to the union organizations. The second is that the opportunities to view texts and documents such as the one stigmatized by the interpellation in today's virtual society are now so many and such that it is at least doubtful that the political opinion of regional employees is formed through the intranet noticeboard, which moreover, as you also underlined, for a simple statistical fact, is also accessed by people who do not share what is supported by the flyer, who have a vision opposite to what the flyer itself perhaps wants to convey.

class: AMMINISTRAZIONE REGIONALE, Ordinamento degli uffici e del personale
name: Andrea Fabrizio
chunk: English: Clearly I want to take the positive side of the answer you gave us, net of the considerations, which is a reflection on the theme of the right to publication. It is a positive side because it certainly opens up a reflection. President, you rightly said, I don't know if ironically or more seriously, that obviously this does not mean censoring anyone's opinion. I would like to claim this, as I have already had the opportunity to say on the occasion of the discussion of the motion of the PCP colleagues: I am a careful defender of Article 21 of our Constitution which, even more than the Workers' Statute, guarantees freedom of expression. As you will remember, however, and as some interventions, always in that discussion, have recalled, also recalled by colleague Perron, what we unfortunately must always keep in mind is what can or cannot be done in public spaces, that is, guaranteed by everyone. No one wants to censor what is published, by one side or the other. English: I am certain, Mr President, that if tomorrow a non-left-wing union were to publish a manifesto, for example, on the demonstration for President Trump's victory yesterday, alerting a demonstration with all the signatures, with the signatures of the center-right parties underneath, some left-wing union would most likely have something to say. I could give all the possible reasons, but it is clear that that would be a classic example of communication that has nothing to do with work. Here we are not discussing whether or not to censor someone, here we are discussing how to use the spaces that belong to everyone. What you said is right, that is, that with social media today communication has multiplied and therefore there is no difficulty in accessing information, this is very true, but precisely for this reason it reinforces our idea that public spaces - we are talking about the union noticeboard, we are talking about public spaces such as for example the Cittadella dei giovani, which has been the scene of some events in recent days - must have a profound respect and profound political secularism within them. No one can use spaces to bend, one way or the other, their own narrative. Everyone has their own channels, everyone has the faculty and the possibility to say what they deem most appropriate, outside of the channels that are paid for with everyone's money, so this faculty must be guaranteed, but it must be limited and a public channel like the one that was exploited must not be exploited. Everything can be said but, I repeat, what has been done is a selection of communications on union matters that I believe can be done trivially starting from a press release. This is a press release that workers are not interested in, on a political inspection initiative. It is a press release that evidently did not have the right to be published. But I do not care whether it was published or not, indeed, if the union in question had made a press release and sent it to the newspapers, I would have displayed it like a medal. Is this far-left union against me? Very well, it means I am in the right direction. Publishing things like this on everyone's union noticeboard, however... evidently it is not a union matter, this must be reiterated. We will therefore wait for the results of this verification, of this in-depth study that you announced to us, and we hope that this can be a way to overcome this distorted use of the tools, which instead should be made available to workers and their representatives for proper reflections on the subject of work and on union matters, which are absolutely necessary, useful and above all that support workers who are not involved in politics.

class: PROTEZIONE CIVILE, VIGILI DEL FUOCO E INTERVENTI PER CALAMITÀ NATURALI, Vigili del fuoco - Difesa antincendi
name: Erika
chunk: Let's return to a recently discussed topic, which is that of the recruitment of Firefighters. As we know, a new law has been approved. In this new law there were amendments, including one from our group, which concerned the possibility of accessing the competition, which has been drastically limited by this latest law, because it went from 32 to 26 years, implementing, as we were told, the national legislation. By not implementing the national legislation, however, we remain at 38 years, instead of 37, for what concerns the volunteer Firefighters. We have represented, within the debate on this law, the fact that there was a lack linked precisely to the people who in 2012 could not participate in the competition because they were too young and now will not be able to participate in the competition because they are too old. We also remember the serious statements of the President, for which we are still waiting for clarification, or at least a public apology; if he reviewed and re-heard what he said, which could also be a reason for a possible request for an apology today, otherwise we will certainly talk about it in the next Regional Council. In this sense, the President had also pointed out that I had not taken care of doing the counts properly, and I confirm this, because my request for access to the documents arrived after I presented the amendments, so it's not that I didn't take care of doing the counts, but I hadn't been able to take care of doing the counts. Now I have them too. What we are asking for is: to understand the number of registered and eligible candidates for the 2012 Fire Brigade Forestry Corps recruitment competition between the ages of 26 and 29, that is, the age group that would be excluded from this new competition; the reasons why the 38 years were instead maintained, compared to national legislation, because, if the objective is alignment with national legislation, we ask why the 38 years were instead maintained for volunteer personnel; if the regulation is being considered to allow those who were unable to participate in the 2012 competition to be able to participate in the next one.

class: PROTEZIONE CIVILE, VIGILI DEL FUOCO E INTERVENTI PER CALAMITÀ NATURALI, Vigili del fuoco - Difesa antincendi
name: Renzo
chunk: Question one: "The number of registered and eligible candidates for the 2012 competition for the recruitment of the Aosta Valley Fire Brigade Corps between the ages of 26 and 29". The candidates registered for the 2012 competition between the ages of 26 and 29, that is, born between 9 August 1983 and 8 August 1986 were 93; the eligible candidates between the ages of 26 and 29 were 12. "The reasons why 38 years was maintained as an entry requirement for volunteer personnel": given that the difference compared to the state limit was only one year, it was decided to maintain the age limit set by regional law 37/2009, slightly more extensive, to encourage the participation of volunteer firefighters. "If we are considering changing the rules, in order to allow those who were unable to participate in the 2012 competition to register". Honestly, it may be our limitation, but it becomes difficult to understand the meaning of this question, considering that the law has just been approved. In any case, the 2012 competition has closed its path, the next competition will have the expected rules, with the participation requirements indicated in the new law.

class: PROTEZIONE CIVILE, VIGILI DEL FUOCO E INTERVENTI PER CALAMITÀ NATURALI, Vigili del fuoco - Difesa antincendi
name: Erika
chunk: Of course we will return to talk about this topic in the next Regional Council, the interpellation is already ready, so we will understand better what the personal interests were, because from the data that the President has provided at this moment we can well understand that the number of members in that age group, in those three years, was certainly a percentage of no small importance. However, we are talking about 93 people and 12 eligible. Compared to the 64 eligible, we are talking more or less about 53%. We sincerely believe that, from this point of view, an explanation could have been given. In addition, to help you in the answer to the next interpellation, I can tell you that in fact the amendment we had presented was poorly constructed because, as you rightly said, you could participate if you had turned 18 on August 10. By putting the years as we had indicated in that amendment, we would have still excluded a whole part, both from 1994 and from 1998, because in fact, analyzing the documentation that I received, I was able to ascertain that in this sense it could be expanded. I am pleased to hear that the rules, once approved, cannot be changed in these matters. I want to give two examples: we are in 2010, in May 2010 the rules for access to the Forestry Corps staff were voted on, where middle school was foreseen and in July 2010, not even six months passed, this was modified and we went back to middle school. This is a case. Let's go back to a more recent case: the municipal secretaries. Let's go and make an omnibus which, as we said, creates problems and difficulties with respect to recruitment, let's go and look at the budget variation, which we should approve shortly, and there too we modify the rules. When you want, the rules can be modified. The boys who are in the 1995, 1996, 1997 and 1998 years are 4,000, we are excluding the possibility for 4,000 boys. Of course, not all of them may want to be a firefighter, of course, but of these 4,000 boys maybe a small percentage could be there, we are excluding the possibility for those boys to be able to participate today, after not having been able to participate then; furthermore, not being able to participate in the national competition, because this could be the observation, because here in Valle d'Aosta we still have the middle school diploma, while at the national level there is the lower secondary school. If this is not total discrimination, I wonder what we are talking about.

class: FINANZA REGIONALE E LOCALE, Partecipazioni azionarie regionali
name: Chiara
chunk: This interpellation returns to the very important issue of the procedure used for the appointment of the directors and the board of auditors of CVA EOS S.r.l., an issue that we had already raised with a question discussed in the Council on 22 May. On that occasion we had highlighted that in our opinion the provisions of regional law 20/2016 had not been respected in the appointment procedure. Following that discussion, on 31 May the president of CVA had written to the President of the Region, to the President of the Regional Council, to the President of Finaosta and to the undersigned, as proposer of the question, complaining about a distorted interpretation of the regional law. The letter then concluded with a pressing request to the Region and Finaosta to publicly clarify the controversial aspects. To correctly frame the matter, it should be remembered that CVA EOS S.r.l. is a company wholly owned by CVA S.p.a. and that, for the appointments of its administrative and trade union bodies, the same rules provided for CVA S.p.a. must be applied. The regional law, as we have repeatedly highlighted, in fact states that the rules on the procedure for appointments apply to the Compagnia valdostana delle acque and its subsidiaries. Despite this provision of law, the same procedures were not applied in the designations of the administrative bodies of the two companies. For CVA S.p.a., the public evidence procedure was carried out, while for CVA EOS this did not occur. This is not just a formal issue, but a substantial one, because the difference in procedures allowed an abnormal situation to arise. In fact, as emerged in the discussion of the question of 22 May 2024, a managing director was appointed to manage CVA with an all-inclusive annual salary of 50,000 euros, while the same managing director was appointed to manage CVA EOS, recognizing him, I quote from the words of the President of the Region, a compensation of 300,000 euros for each financial year. This is recorded in the documents. I would also add that we received a report according to which in the shareholders' meeting of CVA EOS, last 14 October, it was decided to distribute bonuses to directors and members of the Board of Auditors for approximately 600,000 euros, of which approximately 200,000 would have gone to the managing director. This is something we will verify, then request the minutes. What is currently happening? That a CEO, selected through a public tender that provided for an annual compensation of 50,000 euros all-inclusive, finds himself in 2024 receiving, overall, emoluments that reach approximately 550,000 euros, perhaps even more. It seems to me that there is something anomalous in all this, or in any case not entirely clear. CVA defends and justifies the procedure followed for the appointments of CVA EOS. The president, in the letter of 31 May, considered our statements to be the expression of an interpretative misunderstanding, arguing that PCP had not taken into due consideration what was stated in the guidelines containing the application discipline of law 20/2016, those guidelines approved with resolution of the Board no. 1591 in December 2022. A resolution that in fact, in our opinion, made statements that were inconsistent with the law. In the aforementioned letter from the president of CVA, at a certain point there is also an evident concern about the level of adequacy of the examination of the issue of the appointment procedures by Finaosta and the Region, to the point of hypothesizing, absurdly, an unheard of carelessness on the part of the Region and Finaosta. We do not know whether it was an unheard of carelessness or a choice, however, on our part we can only reiterate what is clearly written in the regional law, as well as underlining that an interpretation given with an incautious resolution of the Council cannot exceed what is established by a law. This is what we thought, however, not having sufficient expertise, we wanted to delve into the matter, acquiring a pro veritate opinion on the subject, which we will make available, which was drafted by Professor Caruso, a university professor of corporate law. What did we ask Professor Caruso? We asked this question: "With regard to the application of the procedure for the designation of members of the corporate bodies of CVA and its subsidiaries, is there a discrepancy between what is stated in Article 2-bis of Regional Law 20/2016? This is what is stated in the application guidelines of the law, approved with resolution no. 1591 of 14 December 2022. We therefore ask to know whether the same procedures provided by the regional law for the designations of CVA S.p.a. must be followed for the designations of the corporate bodies of companies established and controlled by CVA". Professor Caruso's conclusion... There is a detailed opinion, however in essence, at the end of the analysis, what did he tell us? "The discipline dictated by article 2-bis, paragraphs 2, 3, 4, 5 and 6 of regional law 20/2016 regarding the appointment of the administrative and control bodies of regionally-owned companies applies to CVA S.p.a. and to the companies controlled by it. Any conflict between the regional law and the implementing guidelines of the same law must be resolved by affirming the prevalence of the legislative discipline". The issue is very relevant, also because it does not only concern the two companies I mentioned, but also many others, so CVA's concern and the president's request for clarification are understandable. In fact, that letter of 31 May sent to the regional authorities and to Finaosta ended by asking for a public response to the questions raised. In conclusion, the interpellation poses two questions to the President of the Region: "Whether the Region and Finaosta have responded to the letter of 31 May signed by the president of CVA and to his pressing request for clarification" and "What do you intend to do to promptly apply what is provided for by the regional law on the appointment of the administrative and control bodies of CVA S.p.a. and its subsidiaries. I would add that after the presentation of the interpellation, filed on October 25, we learned - by reading the minutes of the Shareholders' Meeting of CVA S.p.a., obtained through access to the documents - that Finaosta, in the person of the then president Nicola Rosset, actually sent a response on July 5, 2024. We do not know what was responded to, we asked for a copy on October 28, the canonical days for urgency have passed but we have not received it. Surely, however, the President of the Region can report on its content, because Finaosta responded. As we do not know, just as we do not know if the Region also responded. Obviously then there is also the second question, on which we await answers.

class: FINANZA REGIONALE E LOCALE, Partecipazioni azionarie regionali
name: Renzo
chunk: Before providing answers to the questions posed, I would like to underline that multiple clarifications have already been made on the issue over the last two years, specifically with regard to the regional designation discipline of regional representatives on the objective scope of application of regional legislation. Furthermore, it seems appropriate to dwell on the tone of the initiative, completely disrespectful of the work of the offices of the Presidency, competent on the procedures for the nomination and designation of participating companies. Asking for explanations on the work of the offices is completely legitimate - and on the other hand the council initiatives are aimed at this - it is another thing, however, to attack the offices by stigmatizing, in the absence of any contradictory discussion, their unheard of carelessness or, even - a much more serious statement, because it presupposes voluntary and conscious behavior - the considered choice not to respect the regulatory provision. All this on the basis of the conclusions submitted by an external consultant, in an opinion given to the Councilor, in the light of evidence, in the face of her interpretative doubt on the applicable legislation of which the offices were never informed. Even in the face of this lack of information on a question that must be examined only and exclusively from a legal point of view, without attributing patents of foolishness or bad faith, the accusations made against the offices with the interpellation are therefore extremely unjustified and completely specious. As regards the questions, instead, I provide an analysis developed by the competent offices, which indicate - as the regional law 20/2016 states, in article 1, paragraph 1-bis - that "the provisions of this law do not apply to the subsidiary Aosta Factor S.p.a., nor to the subsidiary Compagnia valdostana delle acque-Compagnie valdôtaine des eaux S.p.a., and its subsidiaries", with the exception of article 2-bis, paragraphs 2, 3, 4, 5 and 6, and article 4 and article 5, paragraph 3, relating to the verification of knowledge of the French language, within the procedures for hiring non-managerial staff of article 6 and article 9. Article 1 therefore delimits the scope of application of regional law 20 with respect to some companies, to which only some of the articles of the same regional law apply; if this is the general rule - referring to the scope of application and to the individual provisions referred to in Article 1, to which reference must be made in order to understand how much and to whom these provisions apply - in the case of the regional designation and nomination procedure the reference is to Article 2-bis of Regional Law No. 20 which, in paragraph 2, establishes that "Finaosta appoints the members of the administrative and control bodies of companies with indirect participation and held within the scope of the interventions of the special management referred to in Article 6 of Regional Law No. 7 of 16 March 2006". It is therefore to this provision that we must refer to understand which are the companies with indirect regional participation in which the directors are appointed, following designation by the Regional Council, at the end of the procedure governed by paragraphs 3 to 6 of the same article 2-bis: in this provision, as mentioned, the reference is first of all to the concept of appointment: "Finaosta S.p.a. appoints the members of the administrative and control bodies" and another important reference is that "To the indirect participation and held within the scope of the interventions of the special management referred to in article 6 of the regional law of 16 March 2006, no. 7". The progressive and multi-subject formation procedure (since it also involves the Region), started by Finaosta - in paragraph 3, with the publication of a public notice for the search for candidates that ends with a designation resolution transmitted by the Region to Finaosta S.p.a. for the purposes of appointment - is a procedure referred by law only to companies in which Finaosta is a partner on behalf of the Region and in which, as a partner, it exercises, according to ordinary civil law, the power to appoint directors and other corporate bodies in the Assembly. Following the resolution of designation by the Regional Council, Finaosta then exercises its prerogatives as a partner, ensuring that the designation of the Region effectively translates into the subsequent appointment of the subjects identified by the public body, without prejudice to the fact that (as established in article 2, paragraph 3, of regional law 20/2016 - the current state legislation) the power to formalize said appointment belongs solely and exclusively to the Assembly. What is regulated by Article 2-bis is therefore the designation and nomination procedure in which the subjects involved are respectively and necessarily the Region and Finaosta: the Region, as the body that designates, and Finaosta, as the body that proposes the nomination in the Assembly, but - according to the provisions of the civil code, which cannot be derogated by regional law -, Finaosta can produce the nomination only in the assemblies in which it is entitled to participate, or in those in which it is a member; from this it follows that the designation procedure referred to in Article 2-bis, as also expressly specified in paragraph 2 of the same article, concerns only the procedure in which Finaosta is the owner of shares within the scope of the interventions of the special management referred to in Article 6 of the regional law of 16 March 2006, n. 7. In companies controlled and participated by CVA, in which the shareholding is held by CVA and not by Finaosta, it is CVA that sits in the meetings of its subsidiaries, as a shareholder, to propose and decide on the appointment of directors and other corporate bodies. For these appointments, governed by the ordinary corporate code, therefore the two-phase procedure (regional designation and Finaosta appointment) governed by article 2-bis of regional law 20/2016 does not apply, referring, as mentioned, only to cases in which in the controlled companies the shareholder is Finaosta, therefore CVA S.p.a., of which Finaosta is a shareholder, and not the subsidiaries of the latter, in which Finaosta, not being a shareholder, cannot exercise any power of appointment. Considering this to be the correct reading of the provisions of regional law 20/2016, it is clear that - unlike what was stated in the part of the opinion reported in the interpellation - there is no conflict between the regional law and the implementing resolution, which correctly and in application of the legislative provision states that regional law 14 November 2016, no. 20, applies to the companies Aosta Factor S.p.a. and Compagnia valdostana delle acque S.p.a. and its subsidiaries, exclusively with regard to the procedure for appointing regional representatives within the companies in which they are indirectly involved, through Finaosta S.p.a.. I specify, in this regard, that pursuant to the combined provisions of article 2-bis of regional law no. 20, which makes explicit reference to the role of Finaosta S.p.a., as owner of the shareholdings within the scope of the interventions of the special management referred to in article 6 of regional law 16 March 2006, no. 7, with the article 1 in comment, the designation procedure referred to in article 2-bis does not apply to Aosta Factor S.p.a., since the shareholding is held exclusively within the ordinary management referred to in article 5 of regional law 7/2006, and for shareholdings in companies directly controlled by CVA. It is therefore up to Finaosta S.p.a. and CVA S.p.a. - as direct shareholders respectively of Aosta Factor S.p.a. and of the companies controlled by CVA itself - to propose the appointment of the members of the corporate bodies in the said companies. With the above and thanking the offices for the work they have provided, I hope to have clarified the doubts expressed and I reiterate that it is one thing to express and want to deepen interpretative doubts with the help of external opinions and consultancy, it is another to accuse the offices of ignorance or bad faith, whose task, instead, is precisely that of ensuring compliance with the law and the correctness of administrative action.

class: FINANZA REGIONALE E LOCALE, Partecipazioni azionarie regionali
name: Chiara
chunk: I want to immediately clear the field of a possible misunderstanding, because we do not accuse the offices of inadequacy. The sentence that was reported, which I also explained in the illustration of the interpellation, is a sentence that President Cantamessa used in the letter he wrote to you, to me, to President Bertin and to the President of Finaosta on May 31, in which he says that, if the interpretation were correct - and we believe it could be correct -, this would imply an unheard of carelessness on the part of the offices of the Region and the offices of Finaosta. We do not accuse anyone, if anything it is someone else who has raised this issue. I must say that it is very interesting to read the minutes, which we acquired with access to the documents, and the positions that emerge from Finaosta and from CVA. It is interesting because I believe that, on that occasion, the representative of Finaosta tried to understand a little better how this issue worked and perhaps even created some annoyance in the people who were listening to him, given the report of that minute which, clearly, being a fairly aseptic report, I believe was also made a little softer than I imagine was discussed. On the rest, President, given that you have reeled off a legal treaty, or an opinion, I ask you to be kind enough to receive a written copy of the response, because evidently I am not able to remember, article by article, what is in the provisions of the law, and I am referring to 20/2016 as well as to the resolution relating to the guidelines. I note, however, that you have not answered the first of my questions, that is, you have not told me whether the Region and Finaosta - and I know about Finaosta because I have read the minutes and I know that on 5 July President Rosset wrote to CVA - you have not told me whether the Region responded to that letter. For the skills that I may have, but precisely because then, being very scarce, I asked for a consultancy, I made my answer when I received the material, when I had the opportunity to understand a little better, and this opinion that we have acquired obviously we will make it available to everyone, also because these are consultancy assignments that are provided thanks to the possibility of having contributions to the groups, therefore they are public money that is spent, as far as we are concerned, also to provide materials that are useful to us, but could also be useful to others. However, I ask you, President, to provide me with the answer so that I can fully analyze what you told me. As regards, instead, the opinion that we have acquired and that essentially confirms the prevalence of the law over a resolution of the Board, which also cites guidelines, I must say that the law - you said it at the beginning of your explanation - excludes Aosta Factor and CVA and its subsidiaries from a whole series of obligations, but not those that concern article 2-bis, paragraphs 2, 3, 4, 5 and 6 of the regional law, for which the issue of appointments and transparency of appointments is contained in this article and in these paragraphs. I thank you, if you can give me the answer.

class: FINANZA REGIONALE E LOCALE, Partecipazioni azionarie regionali
name: Stefano
chunk: Mr. President, I am addressing you. My colleague Minelli spoke of a letter that you also received, concerning an important subsidiary company. I wanted to understand why you did not consider it appropriate to communicate it to all the Councilors.

class: FINANZA REGIONALE E LOCALE, Partecipazioni azionarie regionali
name: Chiara
chunk: I would just like to say that the letter is not sent for information to someone, because when a letter is sent for information it is explicit, it usually works like this. The letter is addressed to the esteemed President of the Autonomous Region of Valle d'Aosta, Renzo Testolin, to the esteemed President of the Regional Council, Alberto Bertin, to the esteemed President of Finaosta S.p.a., Nicola Rosset, and to the kind regional councilor Chiara Minelli.

class: FINANZA REGIONALE E LOCALE, Partecipazioni azionarie regionali
name: Stefano
chunk: I would also like to be kind, Mr President, if you could communicate this or at least pass it on to the Councillors, so that we can...

class: FINANZA REGIONALE E LOCALE, Partecipazioni azionarie regionali
name: Stefano
chunk: Thank you.

class: ISTRUZIONE PUBBLICA, Università
name: Pierluigi
chunk: With the month of September this year, the new university center of the University of the Aosta Valley was inaugurated, with a location in the center, performing for the students of the Aosta Valley. There are about a thousand students who attend the university and we all know how chronic the lack of parking spaces is in the city of Aosta, especially in that area. For the kids who attend university in the Aosta Valley it is a significant problem, because it is difficult to use public transportation. At the moment there is no train that works, the morphology of our territory, the side valleys, those who come from outside Aosta... these are all situations that cause difficulty and therefore almost force the kids to arrive in Aosta with their own means, with a car. It is also necessary to take into account the fact that many of these kids also work, do odd jobs and also have commitments to take care of elderly people in the family, so it is also difficult to spend the day at the university and then still have to try to reconcile the use of public transportation with timetables and connections. There is no doubt that we often talk in this Council about promoting study, about promoting the school path of the kids, to increase their skills and level of education. This is a priority that we have looking to the future, so that the kids can then design a life path that is rewarding compared to expectations. At this time, in which there are not even available parking spaces inside the building, these kids obviously park in the spaces that are in the area, which are all in blue zones, so they also spend a lot of money on parking to be able to get to Aosta and attend university. For this reason we proposed this initiative aimed at trying to find a solution, because either you make available and give the possibility of having sustainable parking for this category, which is a fragile category, which often does not produce... clearly we cannot affect the Municipality of Aosta, which is the manager of the spaces, and therefore if we wanted to go in that direction the Region would have to make resources available to the Municipality of Aosta to cover the lost income; otherwise we should find solutions, such as having parking outside and having shuttles that quickly connect the parking lot with the university, because this is an additional load that means, in concrete terms, a few hundred cars arriving in that area every day.

class: ISTRUZIONE PUBBLICA, Università
name: Erika
chunk: Thank you, colleague, for raising the issue of parking for university use. As you pointed out, the project of the University of Valle d'Aosta has provided over 100 spaces for staff and students, which, as you know, was not foreseen for the university when it was located in the old building; and, as you know, until last year students organized themselves differently: either with public transport or parking elsewhere. Today the parking lot, which is an attraction, as you point out, a sort of extra asset, is being completed. For the shortest possible route we have contacted SIV, the company in charge of the construction of the new building, which has confirmed that the work will be completed by the current month of November. This is to reassure and comfort both you and those listening to us. It will soon be possible to use it, I imagine in ways regulated by the university itself, given that the university has about a thousand students enrolled. The university will have to somehow make a regulation for its use. However, I would like to point out, in any case and also for the benefit of the people who are listening to us, that the regional administration, through the structures headed by my colleague Bertschy, has established a series of fare concessions for public transport for university students. For residents of the Aosta Valley, there is a local public transport bus pass that can be used on the entire regional bus network, at a cost of 20 euros per month, with no limitations on daily trips, and a monthly pass with a 60% discount on rail transport, which is currently being carried out via a substitute bus service, with no limitations on daily trips. For non-residents of the Aosta Valley - given that you also mentioned a sort of attraction for students who come from outside - the local public transport bus pass, which can be used on the entire regional bus network, also costs 20 euros per month, with no limitations on daily trips. A season ticket has been created, therefore, that privileges both residents and non-residents, with the possibility of asking the regional administration, for non-residents, for a 60% refund of the cost incurred for the purchase of the monthly rail transport season ticket, now a replacement, on the Aosta-Turin route. This is to say that in any case, even from the point of view of transport, an attempt has been made to address this problem of transport to and from Aosta. I also remember - it can always be useful as a suggestion, also with a view to limiting city traffic and the consequent increase in polluting load, because our goal is not to bring cars into the city, but to prevent traffic from increasing in the city - that it is available, I say this also for the benefit of those who listen to us, at more than controlled rates, the season ticket of 15 euros per month for the De la Ville car park in via 1° maggio, which is the former Cogne area, which has 540 spaces, from which you can comfortably reach the university in less than a quarter of an hour. We are talking about young people, people who are not handicapped in any way, so the invitation is also to look ten minutes from the university. For 15 euros a month you can get a pass, without any kind of limitation, reaching the university in ten to fifteen minutes. I conclude my answer by thanking you again for the initiative, I hope the answer has comforted you. The parking lot will also be finished by November and, among other things, this is an initiative that has allowed me to update, in addition to the times for completing the parking lot, also on the many possibilities related to parking. Among other things, near the university there is also a series of free parking lots. I remember the Ferrando area, which is five minutes away. I was therefore also able to inform about public mobility, which I believe has also been organized taking into account the needs of our young people who attend university.

class: ISTRUZIONE PUBBLICA, Università
name: Pierluigi
chunk: I listened to your answer, Councilor, we knew that there is a parking lot, under construction, with 111 spaces for the staff, but, once the staff is deducted, the students will have very few and above all not enough compared to the needs. If you have done, or want to do, a survey, it is at least a few hundred parking spaces needed for the kids. I will tell you more: you made a speech entirely focused on the fact that we need to discourage the use of the car to get to the center of Aosta. In terms of principle, it is more than acceptable, but in terms of concreteness I can tell you that if some kids and families choose the car it is probably because there is no alternative to their needs, because using the car costs more than public transport. There is no one who by vocation wastes the financial resources available to them, when more is spent than what most people would think is necessary, it is probably because there is a problem. Then we understand very well and we know that there are concessions for the use of public transport, but here there is also a problem of timetables and attendance at the venue, there is the problem that, to arrive and then to leave, maybe it takes two hours to get home, because there will be one bus per hour; if I finish the lesson as soon as the bus has left, it means that I have to wait an hour for the bus and then travel another hour. If this happens every day, you understand that it is a serious inconvenience. If we have made a report of this type, it means that the problem is felt and I believe that the students themselves will report directly to you - because it has been reported to us - the problem they are experiencing, and then we will see if you can find a solution, because I can actually assure you that these are hundreds of cars that need to find a place to park and that today most of them park in the blue zones, because it is not easy to find parking spaces, spending 8-10 euros a day to solve this problem.

class: ISTRUZIONE PUBBLICA, Personale docente e non docente
name: Paolo
chunk: This is a question relating to teachers' fixed-term contracts. In April of this year, 7 teachers, hired on a fixed-term contract, working in our schools, obtained from the Aosta labor court the right to recognition of seniority increases and, therefore, the resulting salary treatments. Specifically, the autonomous region of Valle d'Aosta - it seems, at least, from the news we have had from the press, etc. - was ordered to recognize these teachers, as salary differences, an amount of around 45,000 euros. It is clear that other lawsuits could probably come, in relation to this issue which, as we recall, is quite similar to that of the teacher bonuses of some time ago, which was then resolved, in addition to disbursements of legal fees and compensation, also with specific measures that had to be taken to remedy this problem that was spreading. We also recall that the European Commission has referred Italy to the EU Court of Justice for the abusive use of fixed-term contracts and discriminatory working conditions in schools. According to the European Commission, in fact, Italian legislation discriminates between teachers in public schools with fixed-term contracts and those hired on a permanent basis, because it does not provide for the former a salary progression based on previous periods of service. This may also be questionable from a legal point of view, but that is how it is. Having recalled Article 2, first paragraph, letter a), of the Statute of Autonomy, according to which the autonomous Region of Valle d'Aosta, in fact, has primary legislative competence with regard to the legal-economic status of personnel, we ask the government to know this: "Whether the regional administration has taken note of the aforementioned referral order from the EU Court of Justice" - I think so -, "Whether estimates have been made on what the financial consequences for the regional administration could be as a consequence of the aforementioned orientations of the national and European Union jurisdictional bodies" and "Whether it is the intention of the regional government to prevent further future disputes and, if so, through what specific actions".

class: ISTRUZIONE PUBBLICA, Personale docente e non docente
name: Erika
chunk: Since these are very technical issues, which you are certainly more familiar with than I am, I had the offices write a contribution for me, which in any case also liaised with the Legal Office. I will not answer you politically and then at the end I will make a very small digression, not even political, but of a trade union nature, if you like. Yes, I am aware of the decision of the European Commission that referred Italy. You ask me if the administration is aware of it. Yes, the European Court of Justice, so that the conditions for appeals to fixed-term contracts are reduced, so that precarious teachers have the same seniority increases as tenured teachers... and this in the name of full equalisation of rights. You mentioned, among other things, the issue of the teacher bonus, there we were able to operate at a local level through the tools that are granted to us, precisely because we believe, among other things, in the equalisation of rights of people who do the same things. I would add that, in order to find a concrete solution to this complex issue, which has long been one of the major problems of the Italian school system - and we know it -, national legislative intervention is needed, because Italian legislation, which determines the remuneration of teachers on fixed-term contracts in public schools, does not provide for an incremental salary progression based on previous periods of service. It should be remembered, in fact, that Presidential Decree no. 861/1975, which is the implementing regulation of the Statute, provides that the rules in force for the corresponding staff of institutes and schools operating in the rest of the State apply to the managerial and teaching staff belonging to the roles of the Valle d'Aosta Region, with regard to their legal status and economic and career treatment,. You know this, having also held the role of Councillor for Education for a certain time. We are bound, with regard to legal status and economic and career treatment, by national rules and the national contract. Question two, "Have any estimates been made and what the consequences might be, etc.": it's impossible, the offices tell me - but it's a topic we debate daily, because I don't like to see, obviously, the Region losing in the appeals, just as I don't like to see serial appeals, which in the end bring money to the lawyers and this is obviously public money - but I told you that it's impossible to make any estimates. English: The group of potential beneficiaries is represented by substitutes who have exceeded 36 months of service with fixed-term contracts, but it is not possible to quantify their number, because the number of those who will continue to work in the school cannot be predicted, especially because there is no predetermined need plan for substitutes for the school sector, as fixed-term contracts are defined both during the adjustment phase of the legal staff to the factual situation, and following various contractual events of tenured teachers, such as part-time, mobility or other types of leave, and throughout the school year to cover illnesses, pregnancies, leaves and expectations. We have also discussed this and there is a risk of uncertainty with respect to even the possibility of making estimates that are minimally reliable, precisely because there are so many hours and situations that occur annually, both during the redefinition phase of the staff, after the legal staff, and during the use of leave and all the types of contracts to which teachers are entitled. English: You then ask me "Whether the government intends to prevent further future disputes and, if so, through what specifications". If it were possible, I can assure you that no one would want to deal with disputes on a daily basis which, moreover, always lead to politically not so positive situations. As I said before, where we were able to intervene - the issue of the teacher bonus, for example, is one of these, as well as now, for example, in the definition of the supplementary contract on study permits - we have tried to intervene at the level of supplementary bargaining. In response, I will read you what the offices wrote to me: "It should be noted that, starting from the last PNRR 2023 competition, the logic has been to progressively reduce precariousness, with the provision of a 30% reserve of places for precarious teachers with at least three years of service, even non-continuous, in the previous 5 years". A legislative maneuver has been made which in my opinion was also interesting. With this measure provided for in the national announcement, our Superintendency has provided in the regional announcement of the aforementioned ordinary competition 2023, referred to in the decree of the President of the Region n. 12 of 15 January 2024, to include in the regional rankings all suitable candidates, and not just the winners, thus allowing, at the time of the placements in roles for the 2024-2025 school year, to scroll through these rankings and hire more teachers than the number of positions originally advertised. It is recalled, in fact, that in August the Superintendency of Studies ordered the hiring of 86 new teachers compared to 36 last year. As already mentioned, however, it will be at the national level that it will be necessary to prepare the necessary rules to reduce the use of a succession of fixed-term contracts in the school sector, so we await action at the national level so that this phenomenon, which you have reported as a non-positive phenomenon, can be somehow contained. I continue to assure you that, since meetings with trade unions are very frequent, we are working to try to fix, where possible, the precarious situations and the situations that have negative repercussions on employees who have been working for the school system for some time now.

class: ISTRUZIONE PUBBLICA, Personale docente e non docente
name: Paolo
chunk: I understand very well, of course, that precariousness in schools is a bit like squaring the circle, because it becomes extremely difficult, for objective reasons at times, because the need is almost impossible to determine with certainty, while on the other hand we have this cancer of precariousness that sometimes goes on for years, in a way that is also illegitimate from a constitutional point of view, as a right of people to work and to have job security, precisely. This is a really heavy Achilles heel for our society. I understand, therefore, how there is the will to resolve this issue and that these are issues that also fall on us from above, that we cannot then manage ourselves. Precariousness has been around for too many years, it is too widespread, and I say this on behalf of a party in which Senator Pittoni in particular has been very committed to this area. I believe, however, that something can be done, indeed, a lot. Then, clearly, the sentences arrive in which they tell you that precarious employment is illegitimate and you also have to foresee career progression, which seems a bit paradoxical, for someone who works on a fixed-term basis, but in fact it is a problem of a contradiction in terms that becomes difficult to resolve. What would be appropriate, perhaps, but I'm throwing it out there just as a suggestion, because it really is difficult and I understand very well what a muddy situation this sector is... you told me that you have continuous dialogues with the unions, so try to maintain a continuous dialogue, of course, it's not just the unions that send people to lawyers, of course, I find myself in a sort of vague conflict of interest, because it's true that we all want to avoid spending useless money on causes that are now a given, like those of the teacher bonus, when there are such determined precedents it's now useless, you're almost forced to suffer causes that you already know you'll lose, so it's a truly paradoxical thing, but perhaps in that perspective, sensitize the unions, who are the only interlocutors... you can't go and take them one by one and perhaps it's even difficult to identify the teachers who might have these characteristics; sensitize the unions, try to obtain at least a sort of moratorium in saying that, when, as we are already doing, we implement policies of greater hiring, hopefully with effective national legislative interventions, there will probably be a way to conciliate, or at least prevent the lawsuits in the sense of saying that, once there is a slightly more precise legislative and regulatory panorama, to those who have accrued those rights we will say: "Don't sue us, we will decide how much we owe you", which is always the best conciliatory solution when you know you are indebted to someone, even if, as in this case, through no fault of your own.

class: TURISMO E INDUSTRIA ALBERGHIERA
name: Dennis
chunk: With reference to the G7 Agriculture and Fisheries event that took place from 21 to 29 September 2024 in Ortigia (Syracuse), in the context of the international institutional event that took place from 26 to 28 September, the Ministry of Agriculture, Food Sovereignty and Forests, with the patronage of the Municipality of Syracuse, organized on the island of Ortigia an exhibition of the excellence of agriculture, fishing, aquaculture, the national nursery-forestry sector and the innovative technologies used, as well as events and conferences. Precisely in relation to this event, on 2 September 2024 the Regional Council approved resolution no. 1042 with the following subject: "Approval pursuant to regional law 17/2016 of the participation of the Region in the G7 Agriculture and Fisheries agri-food expo, scheduled in Syracuse from 21 to 29 September", for which 25,000 euros had been allocated. Recall the ANSA news reported on September 27, 2024, where it is reported that the councilor Carrel at the Ortigia Expo declared: "The management of the wolf is urgent, it is necessary to commit to the defense of mountain territories"; taking into account that in the Regional Economic and Financial Document 2025-2027, which was approved by the Regional Council last session, within section 3, in the part of the Department of Agriculture and Natural Resources, the following is reported: "Among the constant objectives of the work of the Department, support for the activity of valorization and promotion of territorial excellence, of the food and wine products of the rural territory and of the savoir faire and its operators remains a fixed point. The Department will directly organize initiatives aimed at promoting the image of the Aosta Valley and the marketing of its products through measures and calls for tenders and will support those organized by other entities". The competent Councillor is therefore asked to know whether, in the discussion held in Ortigia on the future of agriculture and fishing with Italian and European institutions, in his speech he also represented the regional fishing sector, its problems and the related potential for our region; whether initiatives have been undertaken in synergy with the Department of Tourism to best represent, promote and enhance the image of the Aosta Valley during this important Expo agriculture and fishing event; with what methods and strategies it is intended to best promote and enhance a unique image of the Aosta Valley.

class: TURISMO E INDUSTRIA ALBERGHIERA
name: Marco
chunk: The G7 Agriculture and Fisheries, which was held from 21 to 29 September 2024 in Ortigia, saw the involvement of all the Italian Regions. The event represented, for the Aosta Valley, an opportunity of primary and absolute importance, in order to enhance the agri-food excellence of our territory. The Agriculture Department of our region, supported by the staff of the Promotion Office, guided the guests of the event on various tasting itineraries of the regional DOP products, accompanied by information about the production peculiarities of mountain agriculture and viticulture, by brochures for the discovery of typical Aosta Valley products and by promotional videos and films relating to our territory, selected specifically for the event. As part of this event I wanted to draw attention to the complex realities of our mountain territories, as well as to the issues relating to fishing and the problems also linked to climate change, which will inevitably lead to having to increasingly protect fish reserves and native species. I also reiterated the need to develop and implement strategies to streamline the timeframes for the new programming of the CSR or PSR. Discussion and dialogue, especially on these occasions, on issues of common importance, are essential to develop and implement strategies that are as effective as possible.
